text: I love the place.  Was a bit hesitant at first but friends recommended it, and it turned out to be quite good.  They even have a few choices for those that aren't into Asian fare.
Fantastic food!!! I got the vegetarian pho with tofu. Got there 5 minutes before closing and they still sat us! Incredible food and incredible people.

It was just ok. Pho was mediocre. However, our chicken in the combination dinner was tough and dry. It's probably one of the few Vietnamese places in N. Scottsdale but if you are willing to drive to Phoenix (ex. Da Vang), Tempe  or Chandler you will find restaurants that have more authentic and traditional Vietnamese cuisine. We will stick to traditional American cuisine like sandwiches and burgers or look for Italian restaurants next time we are in North Scottsdale.

Great food. Great service as well. The menu is simple and straightforward, not huge and confusing. I have had a few different items from the menu and all have been delicious. My usual order is the combo beef plus egg roll. My only gripe would be that I wish they were open later for when I get late night cravings.

BEST PHO SOUP IN THE VALLEY! I get the Beef Pho w/ brisket or chicken. Amazing little mom and pop shop! I love the Pho here because not only are the broth & rice noodles delicious but they put green onions in it and give you all the fixings that you want according to your taste. You can put in bean sprouts, thai basil, fish sauce & lemons along with sriracha if you like it spicy.
Very flavorful and lots of fresh ingredients. Was a great lunch. I had the vegetarian Pho and spring rolls. I love the peanut dipping sauce!
Good service and fast delivery each time.  The food, however, not the tastiest.   We have had much better vietnamese food in the area.  Noodles not the tastiest nor the pho

One of the challenges of rating a place like this (as other folks have pointed out) is that there is a pretty diverse range of exposure to this cuisine by the others who have already reviewed it.   Perhaps it was an off day but man was I disappointed. Full disclosure: I am a pho snob. There's one particular favorite spot in San Diego and no matter where I've roamed outside of Vietnam, no place comes close. With that being said, the pho here was just full of sad.  The broth lacked the full-bodied herbaciousness I really appreciate about good pho.  Now, to be fair, this is not marketed as a restaurant specializing in the pho experience but rather has a variety of vietnamese foods (banh mi, pho, bun).   I had the Tea Lite Special...it was not special. Flat flavor profile on the broth. Bland meat. The spring roll was not a win. BUT when the pho came out sans fixins' plate (basil, bean sprouts, lime, jalapenos) and they charged me an extra dollar for it after I went back in and asked for it...that just put me over.   The gentleman at the counter (maybe the owner???) was also pretty surly. All told, I likely won't be back.

Although my Vietnamese friend informed me this particular place wasn't completely authentic, we both agreed that the flavors were fresh, simple and yet still rich and full bodied. I've come here on several occasions, and I'm always satisfied and pleased. All the dishes are I've tried have been pleasing.
Absolute favorite place That my boyfriend and I go. They have a great chicken salad and the Barbequed chicken I to die for.!

Let's not get too crazy with the five stars and Vietnamese food. It's hearty, affordable and fast. It may not be savory but, however, remains delicious for both humble and economic reasons. And that's okay, because I want to experience different cultures and their cuisine without all the American influences.  Tasty offerings include the (#3) beef with egg roll and their "pho bo."  The beef is seasoned "awesomely" and comes with fried spring rolls over a California-king-sized bed of rice noodles and greens. As for the "pho", it is a very delicious soup that you must try at least once in life.  Lastly, compliment your meal with a Tai tea or Vietnamese coffee and you'll leave much more caffeinated (and perhaps happier) than you arrived.
My husband and I stopped in here for lunch.  Fantastic Food and Service........  The Spring Rolls are the best we have ever had....  The soup is amazing....  We will be going back....

Ate here for lunch the other day, food was pretty meh. I'd give 2.5 stars if I could, the spring rolls were very nice and stuffed with shrimp. However, the order of chicken I had was completely dried out -- it was seriously like eating chalk. The flavor was ok, I guess, but the meat was so overcooked it was impossible to really tell.

I really enjoy eating here! The price is very reasonable, the cashier and server are very attentive and helpful. I only wish they were open on Sundays! Have the delicious chicken pho and taro bubble tea!!

Not a lot of selection as far as food goes but it's name is 'Cafe' so how much can you expect? What matters is that the food was good. It's not too savvy on vegetarian dishes but most places are. Cozy. Nice.

This is an attempt at Pho and Vietnamese food.  I am probably spoiled by living in LA for 10 years... but this was rough.   I would have given 2.5 stars if able, because the service was nice, but the Boba (Bubble Tea) was not right and the Pho was just noodles in soup.  This works, because it's the only place in the general area doing this type of food...but i've found some better Pho places in the central/west side of phoenix.  Which is a lot further away if you live in Scottsdale, but it's worth it.  I think this is a great way to introduce people to the "Pho Restaurant" world...but if you think this is good...take a leap, and go to a "real" Pho place.

I've recently become a huge pho fan, so I was excited to try Tea Light Cafe, which is right in my neighborhood.  While it wasn't quite as authentic as a place I was recently turned onto in Downtown LA, it was still very tasty  and fresh.  A cup of hot tea and a bowl of pho is always wonderful on a cold winter day!  At $8, it's enough for two to share, or it can be two meals for one person!  We don't exactly have a lot of independent ethnic restaurants in this area, so it's nice to have Tea Light Cafe serving up yummy Vietnamese food - hopefully people will continue to support it.

We stopped in yesterday at lunch time, it was packed, lined up to the door so we viewed this as a good sign and decided to come back today.  I ordered the vegetarian Pho.  It came with wilted bean sprouts, NO vegetables! Except for a one inch piece of scallion and some tofu and noodles.  The other dish we ordered was a chicken pho, it was the same as the vegetarian pho but with a few ounces of chicken.  I have never had pho served without vegetables. Sliced carrots, book chop, broccoli are the usual fare in pho along with noodles. And to top it off the server was obviously not enjoying his job .  Very disappointing.

I've been a handful of times and always get the tea lite special - it's some rolls with a bowl of pho. Very delicious and the best pho in my hood. The place can get a little crowded because of the smallness but it's definitely worth it. They also offer take out if that's your thing.

Hands-down our favorite fast Asian restaurant.  My husband and I love Asian food and their food is awesome.  The spring rolls are soft, not fried, which we love and the soups are favorites of ours.  Service is fast whether you're taking out or dining in and we love that we see the owners there often.

Great bun, the pork was cooked and seasoned just right, and the ingredients were separated so I could combine them to my taste. The pricing was good except the iced coffee was a bit steep. My partner had the sampler plate and loved it she wow a bit disappointed with the quantity of shrimp for the up charge. We will be back!!!!

So cheap, #3 Bun is my very favorite. I'm here 3 times a week, it's probably unhealthy. I have never eaten in, but the staff is very friendly for takeout. They don't even judge me for going in there all the time :) I would also like to try the Pho! It's supposed to be fantastic.
Hidden gem. I eat here 2 days/wk., always excellent. I regularly order the #3 with beef or tea light special, both very good. At $8.95 for a quick, yummy lunch in north scottsdale, great choice.

Well.... Let's see where should I start. First off if you are looking for a restaurant experience, you won't find it here. No one to greet you at the door showing you to your seat and stuff no, and being it the first time for my bro and I, we had no clue what to do. We saw a big bill board sign with pictures of different Pho types and a bald white guy at the counter. I know...should have seen the sign right? Should have ran when we had a chance. But since it's our first time here in PHX AZ and was craving Pho and don't really have no choice of pho restaurant nearby we said what the hell. BiG MISTAKE!!! So remember no menu  so we picked something from the bill board, being a Pho loving guy and from the Bay Area CA where pho is a plentiful, I'm looking for that #1 Pho you know? Pho dac biet or English Pho combination with everything in it. Bald guy with no name tag said "No we don't have that, just what's up there" So I had no choice but to go with just beef Pho. Now get this we have to pay up front before we get our food and there is a tip line so at that time I'm thinking to myself who am I tipping? The bald white guy taking my order who hands me a cup to get my own water and grab my own utensil? I say Zero for that. The place is small kinda crowded. Anyways so the Pho came, it look decent I posted a picture but soup was on the light side at least for both me and my bro. We agreed it was light, and too small amount of noodle too much onion that it alter the taste of the noodles, NOT Good, very disappointing. We finish quick and left. I only give it one star I can't recommend this place to anyone. Then only good thing was the waiter who chase us down when we left and my bro left his hat. Which merit it a second star. This is NOT A PLACE FOR PHO. Go that extra mile and find another Vietnamese restaurant.

Oh boy! Where do I start? First off, it was 110 in the middle of summer, and they didn't even bother to turn on the AC, only had fans on (#1 big no no, especially given the nice area of Scottsdale). I saw the thermostat say 92 inside!!!!!   Secondly, their menu selection is pretty limited. Just Pho Bo, Pho Ga and a few of their so-called Banh Mi.  I ordered their Pho Bo. Soup was totally bland, the meat was really dry (actually come to think of it, there were barely any beef in it!). Prices were pretty expensive too.  I also tried their pork Banh Mi sandwich. Boy what a mistake, the bread crumbled, the sauce too sweet, the pork was dry. There was no pate in it whatsoever, definitely not an "official Banh Mi".  This place does not do Viet Cuisine justice. It is totally catering to the Non-asian taste.  I would recommend going to Da Vang, Khai Hoan for a good hearty bowl of Pho.

Came in for a bowl of soothing pho one day I when I was feeling especially sick. Pho did not blow me away but it was pretty good. I inquired about tea afterwards to help me feel better as well, and the manager steered me to the appropriate kind for how I was feeling and ended up steeping me a cup on the house.  Amazing how much a small kind gesture like this can make your day when you feel like crap.  Thank you!
Small, but very nice menu. I ordered the pho, and my friends ordered pho and pork chops. We loved it. Will be back soon.

Possibly the best Pho soup I have ever had! I can't believe I ate the whole thing! Well...yes I can, actually.   What clinched it for me was that I ordered it To Go, which is almost never a good idea when it comes to the pho (do not attempt to assemble at your desk! I repeat! Do NOT assemble at your desk!). But everything was securely packaged and well-presented. Plenty of everything (noodles, meat, herbs, sauce, jalapenos, etc) and oh so tasty.   I've got my sights set on the BBQ Pork & Rice noodle bowls for my next visit, which will be soon.   Go get your pho on!
Best pho In North Scottsdale.  Period!  The Tealight special is the best deal in the house, and their herbal chai tea is simply awesome!
This is the best Pho I've found in town yet.  Good spring rolls to, the sauce was a little to runny though.  I hit this place up 3 times a month to get my vietnamese fix.

I work in the same complex as Tea Light and have come here a few times.  The food is amazing; I was honestly surprised as to how good it was. The service is friendly, and quick. Even when I'm not working, I will drive out here to have some Tea Light. They are wonderful.

I'd characterize myself as a Pho Ho (I know that doesn't rhyme) so this rating is going to be lower than what other people may thing simply because my standards for Pho are snobbishly high.  A very cute place, the decor and ambiance seems built very much upon the words "serenity" and "harmony", which is great, but as you might tell with the tone of this post, comes off a little corny.  That said, the food here is not too bad.  For lunch, it's a decently priced meal for a lot of grub.  I got the Shrimp & Pork Spring Rolls and the Pho (which they call Beef Noodles I believe).    My first impression unfortunately when the app came out was that the Spring Rolls used iceberg lettuce instead of basil or mint or a more dark green leafy green.  The iceberg lettuce gave the Spring Rolls a cheaper feel that I didn't really enjoy.  The Pho was better though they seemed quite stingy on the accoutrement, as I got two jalapeno slices and a sorry looking stem of basil.  In addition, the thin slices of beef were definitely overcooked and tasted not unlike a sponge.  But the noodles themselves were solid and the broth with a little Sriracha got my blood and tastebuds pumping.  I don't know if I'll come back but I would say for lunch, this place is not a bad place to introduce somebody to Vietnamese food.
there was barely any chicken or noodles in the pho, really disappointing, but the flavor was good. terrible service.

All items on menu are full of flavor.  You can eat inside or outside. Take home is available too. You get a ton of food for the money. I love the matcha(drink). It's the absolute BEST.  Owners husband and wife, so cool, my first time in I was looking for something tasty, new with a good feeling after I ate it.  I asked what do you recommend for a rookie.  Chicken pho soup, spring rolls. That was two years ago. Kid friendly too.
I like my Pho soup stronger but this is still pretty good and reasonably priced. I would recommend this place.

This place is worth checking out! So good. I usually get the chicken pho. But everything is great. The staff is super friendly as well. I've tried other places for pho but always compare it to Tea Lite Cafe's. Hard for me to go anywhere else!

If you're in the north Scottsdale area and in the mood for pho, Tea Light Cafe hits the spot.  The menu is limited - mostly pho and some rice plates (i.e., your standard Vietnamese fare).  That's okay though, since I found the pho to be solid.  Good broth, though slightly skimpy on the noodles compared to most pho restaurants.  It's a small restaurant.  Wasn't too crowded when we were there, but has the potential to get full I would imagine.  The price is reasonable, though I've definitely had cheaper.  Perhaps it's inherent for the restaurants in the area.

This is the closest place that offers a decent bowl of pho, my comfort food on a cold or cloudy day. I always have my order taken out since this little place is always packed during lunch time.   I've tried the Pho with beef (#11), the Tea lite sandwich with grilled beef, and the Bun (#3). And my fav is the Pho, especially the broth! The sandwich was okay, i thought the grilled beef was a bit too salty.. And the Bun was good, but the same as the sandwich, salty beef...  This is definitely a good place to grab a quick lunch with limited time, fast, affordable, and tasty!!

I've only been here for the sandwiches so far...I can't tell you how often I crave Vietnamese sandwiches.  I used to get them in San Francisco all the time (much cheaper though), and I was quite happy to see one in my neighborhood.  The sandwich was great and the Pho menu looks good, I'm sure I'll be back to try it.  The service was just okay, and the prices are a little high, but all in all, I'm glad it's there, and will return for sure.

I have been going to "TLC" for a couple years now.  This is a great spot located near the movies at the Scottsdale 101 shopping center.  The number one thing, in my opinion, about restaraunts is consistency.  I have never been let down here.  I usually get the same thing everytime i go so I cant really comment on the depth of the menu.  But if you like Summer spring rolls which are packed with noodles, shrimp, pork, chicken wrapped in rice paper you will love the ones at Tea Light.  I follow the summer rolls with a huge bowl of chicken soup.  This soup has a phenominal flavor with asian noodles and a genorous amount of tasty chicken.  There are sauces left out on the tables so you can make your soup as spicy hot as you want.  The very casual order counter and friendly service allows for an evironment that makes you feel like you are at the neighhborhood Cafe.  You will see the same people there everytime and they are as nice and appreciative of your business as they can be.   If you are looking for a good lunch or a healthy dinner...TLC is your spot!
I love this place ! If I can have their shrimp Pho  everyday I will... so tasty, perfect size portion. Casual place.. highly recommended!

New to Arizona and have been dying to find a Pho place! I have found my new home! This is the best place I have had Pho since living in Central California! Very happy customer!!! I can't wait to come back!

What a great little spot!  Went last night and I ordered the pho and she ordered the chicken soup. We both loved our food and would go again for sure. The pho was so good, I finished the whole monsterous bowl!   The owner (I am guessing he is the owner) was working and was very helpful.   Don't be discouraged that this is located in a strip mall.   Do yourself a favor and give it a try. It is cheap and worth the experience.

I miss this place! I used to get lunch from here quite regularly when I worked in the area - excellent noodle bowl with imperial rolls, fresh veggies, and great tea. Well priced. Friendly and quick service.
We had a great beef pho.  The owner was extremely kind and let us grab some takeout even as they were closing.  We sat outside and enjoyed a great meal.
Great place an inexpensive and tasty lunch .... I've been there many times and it's always excellent!

Ordered the Tea Light Special with veggie pho. The staff were super friendly and my food came out quick. This was my first time here and the gentleman who dropped off my food noticed I didn't get silverware and napkins (I didn't know I get them on my own), so he brought some to me. The Pho was delicious although I wish it came with more bean sprouts, lines, jalapeños and cilantro on the side. Would definitely come back here again.
Good Vietnamese food.  Fairly priced.  My go to for Vietnamese food.  Glad it it still around is the midst of the many Scottsdale eateries in the area!

I haven't dined in, but have ordered takeout from here twice so far. Both times my order has been ready right on time, and my cold drinks were kept in the refrigerator until pickup so they stayed nice and cold. I can only speak to the pho and the coconut boba. The pho is ok - just ok. The first time I got it the broth was a little bland (but not any more bland than most places), and the second time it was almost too salty, but didn't have much of the traditional pho spice flavour. The first time my take-home ingredients looked fresh and they gave us quite a bit, and the coconut boba was perfect. The second time it looked like there was a little less meat and the piece of basil had literally been picked over, so there were only a few small leaves remaining on it. The bean sprouts looked a little wilted and sad. My coconut boba had ice chunks, and only about four actual balls of tapioca, all of which had frozen and had a really strange texture. Since the first time was so good, I'd be willing to order here again on the good faith that the second time was just a fluke.

Dark setting but the pho was good - the noodles were over cooked and mushy. Great having the soda machine - spring rolls were made in a very messy fashion - slow down all the processes and more attention to product. Ordering process not very personal but overall I will try again.

BEST place to eat ever! It's a bit of a drive to get to from where I am, but it is so worth it!  Whoever said it was tasteless lies! This is healthy good food! They give you lime, basil, bean sprouts, etc to go with your meal! I LOVE the little rolls that come with the Number 1  meal. The soup is fantastic!!! The food is the best!
their beef pho noodles was so good and tasty but their boba drink wasn't! it taste like it was water down!

Love this place! I moved here last year from Orlando, which has a suprisingly robust Vietnamese community and tons of great places to get Vietnamese food. I was thrilled to find this near my home and the food is great.  I usually get the chicken pho, which is very good. It comes with sprouts and spices like cilantro, jalapenos, scallions, etc. that you can add to the broth. This allos you to make it as mild or spicy as your mood demands and allows you to play "chef" a little, which is an added bonus.

I like the pho here because it isn't as oily as some others I have had.  Everything at Tea Light Cafe seems lighter than the normal Vietnamese fare, however, it is a nice alternative considering the area.

I get Pho and a taro boba every time I eat here. It's always really well prepared. I wish they had a little bit more variety on their menu, but everything I've had has always been tasty and I love the owner and the staff. Great place to eat before catching a movie
I came in last week because I have been looking for a quality Viapnamese restaurant here in the valley. The food was great, and cashier John was so helpful and gave us great suggestions.

I love this place and try to sneak away for a quick meal chance I get. The food is always fresh and the presentation is lovely. I always get the special because you get a bit of everything for a reasonable price. The spring rolls and the pho are my favorite. Their green tea completes any meal you select.   This is a great choice for a casual meal with friends, family or kids if you don't like to eat alone.

Clean environment,  food is of good quality,  tastes good, and friendly service.  A well deserved 5 star.  A wonderful gem in North Scottsdale especially if you are looking for a good Vietnamese food.

Whether you like this place will depend on whether you have experienced good Vietnamese food in the past. I have lived all over including SF so I know what the food is supposed to taste like. In general the food is just okay here. The spring rolls are below average and the peanut sauce is not right. The pho is just average - not bad, but nothing to write home about. I found a better place just off the 101 and cave creek by Costco... Still searching for a great pho place in N Scottsdale.

What a huge disappointment. Was really in the mood. First the guy gets the order wrong and is slow to correct the mistake. I order grilled chicken. Seems  simple. I have never seen or tasted chicken that looked more like sundries dog turds. Dry, causing me to choke. You can tell I am loving this place. The man behind the counter seemed mildly annoyed taking our order. The girl was sweet if not somewhat clueless. Sound good? Took two bites and left. Wondered why I took a second bite. Sick. They could have cared less. Oh the rice was mushy. Slice of cucumber
Great place to get Pho in North Scottsdale and coconut boba drink. The environment is super cozy and seems to draw a fair amount of people every time I come in.

Great pho and the bun is super good also. This place is run really excellently. Food is delivered quickly and the owner is normally around and making sure every customer is happy. A great option for a healthy quick meal out.

Let's be honest here...is the pho good?...it's mediocre at best and overpriced.  That being said, you do feel safe eating here...so that's worth something and I guess that sense of security makes the pho taste 'good'.   So now let's talk about the waiter...the husband.  For description purposes...he's the white guy and not the older Asian guy. I'm assuming that his wife is the one that is cooking in the back since she came out wearing a purple chef's jacket (sign number 1 that this pho is going to be mediocre). This guy thinks he is actually working at some 5-star Michelin French restaurant. He got upset and gave me a stern warning that my 15 month old baby cannot bring outside food to eat in his fancy restaurant and it was pho or pho-get-about-it!  I looked around and quickly realized my mistake. I should have known that I stepped into the Taj Mahal from the 80's Coke machine next to the door and his son that was walking around 'working' with Dre Beats headphones around his neck and a Kangol style hat!    So I guess this is review is more of a heads up to others to make sure to dress up and be on your best behavior for this super fancy place!  By the way, I heard the wife's purple chef's jacket was a gift from the James Beard Foundation...pho has sure come a long way!  Can you imagine going to Da Vang (a real pho restaurant) and the chef is wearing a colored patterned chef's jacket! Ha! The looks that chef would get from the workers and customers would be epic!

Whenever my children come to town, Tea Light Cafe is the first stop on the way from the airport. Millions of options for dining in Scottsdale, but it's our favorite. Fresh clean flavors and incredibly fast service.

The pork meatball sandwich is the single best sandwich I have ever eaten! The pho is always delicious, shrimp spring rolls are refreshing, and the tea is first rate.  I always feel appreciated when I come here, and I never leave unsatisfied.
Very simplified menu.  The "beef pho" (ha) was surprisingly great; the broth was delicious.  Perfect for a quick bite.
Solid choice for Pho.  Small interior for dining but they also have some seats outside.  If you are craving Pho and you are this far north in Scottsdale it's your best bet!

Very average and the meat seems a bit "mysterious" looking not to mention in my large bowl of pho, I only had 2 small pieces of "chicken".  The pho is a good sized portion but mediocre at best. The spring rolls were average spring rolls. Nothing special about the food here. Pricing is decent. Iwill not go back. Too many other fantastic places.

the food is very good here but the service isnt very nice. they dont greet or thank customers properly. i dont know why the owner is so mean when i come here all the time. so i have to give it three stars for the bad service they need to learn better customer service or at least some manners

Our favorite place for Vietnamese food in north Scottsdale.  Nice folks running the place.  We seem to always get the number 3 but every thing we have had here is good including the pho.  There is a nice outside seating area that is great when the wether is nice.
I am addicted to their chicken pho. It is simple but my body feels great after. It is my Vietnamese Chicken penicillin:) my husband loves their spring rolls. We get their food at least once a week .
Cute little place! We ordered beef pho & spring rolls. Food came out FAST and the pho was hot and flavorful. Since we moved so close, this will be our new place when we crave pho.

Are you looking for really good, authentic pho?  OMG, so am I!  Service is really very, very fast.  The food quality is pretty good.  They say they do not MSG in their broth, but they pour in the salt!  The broth was so overly salty, it was inedible for me.  The beef pho is lacking the authentic bites of tendon & tripe; these are not offered at all.   Gonna keep looking...

I eat here at least once a week.  My favorite meal is #14, with extra beef.  Chris and his wife are very accommodating, nice, and always welcoming.  The atmosphere is light, fun and the staff always has a smile.  Definitely come here for a great time with some awesome Vietnamese food!

Be careful of their green matcha tea. They will charge you around 7 bucks for a small cup of matcha green tea. They say they will add orange juice to "enhance" the flavor. The end result is beyond catastrophic: I got green color diluted, old orange juice.   Their pho is bland and unauthentic. All and all I'm sad I wasted time and money on such a disappointed meal.
Ordered  the pho chicken...  where's the flavor.  ?  Very disappointed.   i only had two small pieces of chicken in the soup...

This was my first visit and I've been wanting to go for some time. It was well worth the wait. I enjoyed it very much. It was a lot of food but, didn't sit heavy on you at all. Very simple food with very fresh ingredients. I had the beef noodle bowl with the egg rolls, next time I want to try out they're soup.

I've been here three times, the food is okay.  The prices are good and the customer service is okay.  If you want a quick, Vietnamese dish such as Pho, give it a try, the prices can't be beat.  One thing that disturbed me as I noticed on my last visit, the owner dumping the remaining customer's water into the money plant that sits in the front when you walk in.  It kind of grossed me out.  As you know our mouths breed bacteria, and it's being mixed and cultivated in that money tree plat.  Yuck!  For that reason alone, I may not come back.

Here's the thing: The service at Tea Lite (i swear it says Tea LIGHT on the sign, but maybe not) is great, everyone is super nice, food comes out real quick and it's also real healthy. You also get a great meal for your dollar. What is keeping me from giving them a higher rating is that it's too safe.  I love to come here for a quick, healthy, inexpensive lunch, but if I want the real stuff I'll go to the competing restaurant a little ways away. The phô at Tea Lite Café is sorta gentrified, a product of the neighborhood that it's in. There's no tripe or tendon in the broth, and there's no option to add it in if you desire a dish a little more adventurous. There are plenty of options if you want to spice it up, but not if you want to add more general flavor to the soup that i expect to enjoy when i go to a Vietnamese restaurant. Maybe it's because their specialty is a quick lunch and therefore a more streamlined menu? I am however super grateful that's one of the few places in the Airpark vicinity where I can get a boba tea!  Now, I am no way condemning this restaurant, and in fact I recommend that you go there for lunch and support them, and if you like, request some of the omitted goodies for your phô so that someday they'll change their menu up and I can grant them a couple more stars.

Some people think that a non-vietnamese clientele means the food is not authentic or as good as other places. Wrong! I have eaten Vietnamese food in Asia, SF, LA, and Phoenix and Tea Light does a good job making customers happy! The place is modern, the staff friendly, and the BBQ is very tasty.  The pork chop is very good, and so is the bbq pork entree. The boba drinks are good too and when I'm in this part of town, I always make sure to stop by and eat there.  It gets 4 stars b/c of course there is better Vietnamese food, but overall this place is a hit!
Waited too long to write this review! Excellent food for a reasonable price! The Pho is a favorite of my sons and I love the bowl with rice noodles and beef plus egg rolls on top! A+

Found this hidden place by accident.  You order at the counter and they bring your food to the table. we started with shrimp and pork spring rolls. They were good and a large portion.  When it comes to Pho the choices are limited to basic chicken or beef. It is definitely aimed towards main stream eaters...nothing exotic here. The chicken Pho was good. The broth was fabulous.  I would try the bun next time... I liked it here and if I was close by I would return. I don't think I will go out of my way to become a regular.

My parents love pho so I've practically been enjoying Vietnamese cuisine since the womb. Ha! No wonder I love it so much myself that it was always on the weekly dinner rotation when I lived in OC. Alas, I moved to North Phoenix and I dont have little pho shops or boba cafes on every street corner. I've learned that I have to drive a ways to Chandler/Mesa to satisfy these cravings. Imagine my surprise when the husband and I noticed Tea Lite Cafe when we changed up our movie theater location this past weekend. Of course, we had to try it out and we'd been dying for some pho for months now.  We both ordered the beef pho and took a seat. The place is small but there's plenty of seating and still feels spacious. The cashier up front was super friendly and welcoming which was nice. We didn't have to wait too long for our food to arrive...another plus.   The pho itself has really tasty broth and the beef was nice and tender. I was disappointed by the small portion of bean sprouts, mint leaves and limes that accompanied the soup. I'm used to overflowing plates of these veggies so I can load up my soup to my heart's desire. In fact, my hubby usually counts on me doing this since I end up eating all my veggies and leaving most of the beef for him. Double ha! But the lack of sprouts and mint leaves didn't put a damper on the great taste of the pho. What I did miss was the traditional pho ingredients like tripe, rare steak and tendons. I know, I know...sounds intense but trust me it makes pho taste soooo good. I guess I just have a usual when it comes to pho so I was a little disappointed when I couldn't satisfy my craving to the utmost degree. Woe is me.   But let me conclude by stating again that the pho here is really good and has a great flavor to the broth. I think the hubby and I will go back since it is so conveniently located to us. It'll definitely do in a pinch although I am sure I will occasionally find myself making the trek to get me some tripe!

My husband and I have enjoyed food from this restaurant on several occasions. Unfortunately my most recent experience has really ruined my opinion. I called to place a take out order and was placed on hold. The person obviously forgot he made this decision.  I could hear him taking order after order. I would have hung up and called back but I knew the line wouldn't disconnect. I walked into the restaurant on my phone and showed him I had been on hold for 17 minutes. He was obviously new and had made an honest mistake. I informed the manager, who looked at my phone, said he was sorry, and walked away. Not only was his apology insincere but he made no effort to rectify the situation. As much as I have enjoyed the food, I am not sure I will return. I have worked in customer service for 20 years and am very disappointed.

Even though the temps are over 100 for what seems to be like 9 months a year these days, I always make time for the soup here.  Tea Light is only like 10 minutes from the office, and it is one of my favorites.  I've eaten here more times than I can count, and I always get the Chicken or Beef soup.  The soup broth is always so flavorful and robust.  I love that they bring you fresh herbs and bean sprouts to add it right at the last second.  It really makes the soup seem so fresh.  I know I shouldn't, but I always finish the broth.  it just seems too good to waste...    The spring rolls are a nice change of pace as well.  They aren't fried, and are packed with good stuff.  One of my co-workers always gets the Pork Ball sandwich, and I don't think you could pry it from his hands while eating it.  The people that run this restaurant are really friendly and always have a smile on their face.  The restaurant itself is tiny, so don't be discouraged if you cannot find a seat right away.

The pho was delicious (i got the beef) and of course, it was a generous serving size. It is a very cute environment with gorgeous tables. It's a neat place to go if you want an adventure. Also the Thai tea was an orange cup of deliciousness! I recommend going!

I have never had pho... But my buddy Jesus eats it ALL the time! So when the team decided to try pho for lunch today, I was in! Get this... Didn't order pho! I asked the cashier what I should get. She compared pho to soup, and well... I don't like soup. So I ordered a chicken and rice noodle dish. It came with 2 egg rolls, and was delicious. I ordered a Taro Bubble Tea, too. I am pretty sure I can't eat again today, but it was delicious. They have three sauces on the table, too. I tried them all, and my favorite was the sweet almost plum sauce. Will definitely go back. Hidden gem, really.

Uh oh... Last two visits have been sub par. The noodles were gummy and seems something is off.  I always get #1 or #3 beef. #3 comes with egg rolls that are really good.  Seems having two locations is starting to put pressure on consistency. I hope my next visit is better.

Tea Lite has a simple menu of just a few items, clean food, and is an easy in and out dinner or lunch. I am a regular here, and go several times a month. I always get one of three things. First, the chicken salad, which is served with a super light dressing and is very clean, leaving you full but not feeling heavy. I also love the chicken pho and veggie spring rolls. And I ALWAYS have to compliment my meal with honeydew or mango boba or a green matcha tea (delicious). What I love about this place is that it is privately owned, and the owners are always there. It's small, and although it's busy around lunch hour, it is still fairly quiet and a nice place to sit and read a book while eating.

My review is only for the spring rolls which I got as take out.  I asked that tofu be used instead of shrimp.  They were $6.99 for 3.  Nice size and full of fresh greens and enough tofu.   I checked out their menu and plan to try their PHO.  I have had PHO in many places (worldwide) and I know what a good PHO is.  I will report on my adventure with PHO at Tea Light Cafe as soon as it happens.

I'm giving Tea Light Cafe an extra star (well deserved) for being an independent restaurant in the middle of corporate-eatery-Scottsdale. But rest assured, the food, value and experience merit a solid 4 stars if not higher. I dine here often and every meal has been spot on. Ethnic food is a staple of mine and Vietnamese dining is always a treat; I think it's healthier than other varieties, but what do I know. I'm still eating off value menus.  I've had the Pho several times, and it's very good; but I'm not a big Pho fan. It's soup. I don't care how big the bowl is... soup is not a meal. It's an appetizer. If I want a light meal, I order their Spring Rolls. They're loaded with shrimp and some other meat (I think it's pork) and the wrapping is see-through. I can see what's inside the roll.  I love them. Yes they are appetizers too, so if you follow my philosophy, they should not count as a meal either.  But they are shaped like hot dogs, which are a meal. Are you following this?  My favorite dish is "The Number 3" which is a huge bowl filled with rice noodles, grilled beef, lots of veggies and it's topped with an awesome egg roll. See the pic uploaded by Renick T. That's my dish and I'm sticking with it. This dish is featured at many Vietnamese establishments.  Tea Light does it very well. When I eat this dish, the entire world comes into balance and I feel an inner connection to the universe.  The Buddha statutes in the shop come to life and smile lovingly upon me, my meal, my table and my pals.  OOOOOHHHHHMMMMMM.

First, overall impressions are very good. This is a nice, simple, hole in the wall. It's a simple, friendly introduction to Vietnamese cuisine. It is what it claims to be - a "Vietnamese Deli". You order at the counter and your food is brought to you.   I had the Beef Pho which had a very nice broth (once I added the requisite amount of chili sauce - personal preference) with tasty meat and rice noodles. The amount of meat was a bit skimpy, but ok. My friend had the chicken salad which was basically a salad topped with grilled chicken meat, which was accompanied by a very tasty dressing. I had a nice green tea with pomegrenate that was very tasty. Didn't sample the Vietnamese Coffee as I didn't want to have a particularly late night. This is a place I'd come back to for a simple meal before or after a movie at the nearby Harkins Scottsdale 101.   Some of the possible negatives are price (a bit high, but heck it is Scottsdale, and the rent must be a small fortune at that shopping center), and the lack of choice.   Grades (a new tradition in my reviews)  Overall:  B  (there is only one grade for food, and nothing meriting an                        overall grade reduction) Service - No Grade - as there is no real table service here. Folks at the                  counter were nice though Food -     B - Above average. Good, fresh, simple Vietnamese food,                   albeit overpriced.  Drinks -  No Grade - as I didn't sample the Vietnamese Coffee, and                 no alcoholic beverages are served here.

There are only 3 words you need to say at this place: "tea, light, special."   For soup lovers out there, this will not disappoint. One area which could be improved is the quality of the meat used (particularly the beef.) Prefer the chicken for this reason.   Overall, great food for a good price.

I visited Tea Light Cafe for the first time last night with a friend. I had been feeling under the weather all day and had been craving pho for a couple weeks. Adding the two together, I knew what had to be done.  Tea Light Cafe is tucked (almost hidden) between a large movie theater and a bunch of other mall-ish restaurant and department stores. You've got to be looking for it, or you're likely to miss it.  The parking lot is very large but even still, it took us a while to find a spot. Not sure why, to be honest. I ordered the beef pho, my friend ordered some kind of a grilled chicken dish, then we found a seat just outside the front door.  The view outside was beautiful: A Ferrari parked beside a BMW parked beside a Cadillac parked beside a Maserati. But enough about the cars - how was the food?  The pho was just what the doctor ordered, without a doubt. The warmth of the broth of pho has always been very comforting to me. Was this the best pho I'd ever eaten? Not necessarily. But I still enjoyed it very much.  My friend's chicken dish was beautifully presented, but appeared somewhat dry. She confirmed that it lacked a bit of character, but made do by mixing sauces and enjoyed it nonetheless.  Tea Light Cafe is not very close to where I live, but I would consider it worth the trip. It is rated pretty highly across hundreds of reviews, and I'd agree that its rating is well-deserved.  If you haven't been, and you're into Vietnamese food, I would recommend a visit. I know I'll be back.

Maybe it's because I first tried this place on a day I got some GREAT news, but I REALLY like Tea Light.  I've experienced the greatness that is Tea Light twice now and I can honestly say this place hits the spot in my world.  I am so happy to now have a go-to place for excellent take out, which is not your ordinary meal.  So far I've tried the beef pho, the chicken sandwich, the egg rolls, and the beef noodle bowl.  Everything was great!  I really liked the freshness of the chicken sandwich and the awesome sauce that came on it.  The pho is great and I love that it comes with everything you need to jazz it up on the side.  Since I am not a fan of cilantro, I was happy the second time that they honored my request to not put it in the soup... yay!  The egg rolls are crunchy deliciousness, which is a complement to any meal.    Basically what I am trying to say is I am thoroughly happy to have found this place- thank you yelp once again!

Just a little place tucked away by the movie theater but well worth walking through the door. Always people inside which I take as a good sign. Friendly staff and fresh tasting food. The pho is great and I love t he spring rolls. Will definitely be back.

Pho soup tastes like a combination of a generous scoop of salt, small cup of beef broth, and a msg bomb. Spring roll wrap was rubbery and chewy. Luckily the filling was fresh.  It's lucky for the restaurant that it is one of few choices if you want pho in the northern side of town. It is simply not remotely comparable to the Vietnamese restaurants in Tempe/Chandler.

We love this place. We often go there before or after a movie. The menu is simple, egg rolls, spring rolls, pho soup, and beef, chicken and port over noodles, or some combination of the above. Nothing elaborate, but its filling and seems healthy.   Everything we had was good, but I took off one star because their ordering isn't as easy as it should be. There are pictures of about 10 on the menu overhead, but you eventually learn there are more choices than this, and the menu overhead doesn't have the prices. Look at the takeout menu instead. Same stuff but better descriptions and with prices.   Most entrees are $7 to $10. Not the best bargain for some noodles and egg rolls, but OK for Scottsdale.  Overall a reliable place with good food, and good service. Once you learn the menu, its even better.

So this is the type of place where you order at the register, sit down, and they bring you the food. I agree that it caters to a different crowd than most pho places. If you actually try to ask for pho, they look at you quizically, like, "soup?"  I always get the chicken pho with tofu added. Their chicken is always tender, and always clean cuts. Maybe its just me but I dont like chewing on blood vessels. Never had that problem here. This is probably my number one reason for returning so many times. The pho is really good and they bring you your delicious iced coffee in a to-go cup. How convenient!  I only dinged a star because theyre pretty skimpy on the greens to add in, especially the basil compared to some other pho spots. I was sitting outside enjoying my pho when another patron asked the man if she could have more basil, and he literally said that he didnt have any more. Apparently they dont keep much on hand.  STILL, I love love love their pho and their quick, easy service and yummy coffee. Ive noticed they also have bahn mi & I will be giving it a try there.

Love this place b/c it reminds me of the amazing Vietnamese I could get in L.A.  I've been searching for it since I left and I have finally found the noodles, bbq beef, eggroll, cilantro and fish sauce combo I fell in love with the first time I had Vietnamese.  I can't say I've tried anything else on the menu b/c it's so dang good, I can't stray.  Since I was there two years ago, they've thrown a little money into the decor and it's turning out to be a pretty cute joint.  They also started doing fancy green teas, hot and cold and have made some menu additions that look tempting.  It's right next to the movie theatre and I go there any time I'm on that side of town.  I wish I lived closer.

Best recommendation to get: the tealight special, which includes 2 egg rolls, a spring roll and pho bowl. The food is fresh and the dipping sauces are great! The beef pho was decent, but the meat to noodle ratio was a bit off. I wish they put more meat :(

Pros: -Got the veggie pho to go, and it tasted heavenly. The broth had a lovely ginger taste and was nicely salty. I can see the broth potentially being too salty for some, but it was perfect at the time. -They separated the broth from the noodles/veggies in their own containers for takeout, which was very helpful for preserving the taste and quality of the pho. -They were generous on the green onion and cilantro, which are my favorite veggie add-ins to asian soups. -They seem to have some very interesting tea choices and tea-ware, like teapots and cups. Since we were getting takeout, we didn't try these options. There are several glass canisters of interesting looking teas to the left of the registers and if you so decide to try this place, I would give some of those teas a taste.  Cons: -A more expensive than other pho places with arguably competitive quality. Our total for 2 veggie phos and 2 boba drinks was a little under $27. However, it does seem to be pretty far from other cheaper and high quality alternatives (like the ones you  find near asian markets), so the price may just reflect the lack of neighboring competitors in this area. -The veggie pho option pretty much only came with tofu, regular onion, green onion, and cilantro, excluding your usual bean sprouts, mint, jalapeno that seem to come with every order of pho at most places. At other restaurants, they may include other veggies like broccoli, carrots, and peas or whatnot. It's not a big deal for me, because the pho was still delicious, but I think the price should be lower to reflect the scant ingredients? The veggie pho at the other aforementioned place was about $5-$6.  -The boba was very meh. The smoothie flavors tasted exactly like the fake-tasting powders you can buy at LeeLees and the boba was a little too rigid. The chewiness was still pretty good. Not the worst boba I had, but far from the best.  Verdict: I won't be coming back, mostly because this was an impromptu take out adventure on our way out of town for a road trip and there's no way this place is convenient for us to stop by again, but even if I was overcome with the desire to eat pho, I would go to places with cheaper, better pho and better boba. I'm not giving it a terrible review though because all I got was take out one time. Don't get me wrong, if you just don't have any other closer options for pho and don't mind paying the higher than average price, then this is a solid choice.

This place is awesome! I have been coming here for years, and have never had an experience that was less than stellar.  The pork chops frequent my dreams, the egg rolls combined with the fresh mint are incredible, and all the soups and sandwiches are great lunch options.  What makes this place so great? Well, first and foremost is the freshness of the ingredients.  Second is the simplicity of the menu, there are not a ton of options, but everything is excellent.  Third is the service; always friendly and efficient.    If there is one problem it is that seating can be limited during busy times, but that just speaks to how awesome this place is.  I have recommended Tea Light to many people and they have all loved it, so if you haven't tried it, you missing out.
Fantastic food and a great deal to boot. PLEASE put one in Gilbert!  Great service. Fast and really tasty. Place was packed for lunch.  Small but really good.

I'm vising from the Bay Area, where great Vietnamese places are on every street corner, and I've been searching for some local Vietnamese places for some time. I was VERY happy to find this place!  If there's one thing I don't like about Scottsdale, it is that most 'good food' places are way too fancy; I want 'holes in the wall' with stellar food and this place fit the bill.    I'll be back to try their sandwiches, but the Pho (soup) was a good start.  Everyone seemed to know the owners, who obviously take care of their clientel.

Good authentic, traditional Vietnamese spring rolls (that to me is the fried rolls) are few and far between with today's Vietnamese restaurants in the valley. This has been our favorite place to get spring rolls for years. The spring rolls at Tea Light Cafe are delicate and prepared to perfection. Served with heaping mounds of fresh lettuce, basil, mint and shredded carrots you just can't find a better spring roll in Scottsdale. Although a rare occurrence, we do order other items on the menu. The Pho soup is also very, very good along with their Vietnamese sandwiches, and main course meals. Thumbs up for Tea Light Cafe!

One of the best places for Pho in the valley!  You would never think this place in a strip mall next to the Harkins would have such authentic delish Pho!  Great prices, just wish it had more seating inside.

I was craving Bun with chicken and discovered this place via Yelp. Turns out it's about a mile from me which is a huge bonus. Their Bun totally hit the spot and I really liked the egg rolls. I just moved here from the Bay Area where Vietnamese is plentiful. TLC ranks up there with the good CA places I've eaten at.   The atmosphere of the place is warm and cute. Very clean. The owner was there and very nice. Took good care of my needs. You will be seeing me there on a regular basis :)

I had okay service, nothing too outstanding. But, I really love a lot of their stuff. Their food is delicious and I've heard their pho is super great. Used to regular when I was over there more... I miss this treat

I have nothing to compare this too as I've never eaten Vietnamese food ever. I've also never tried pho. Stopped here for lunch on a whim and it was delicious! The place was packed (good sign) and my husband and I got the sampler thing (pho, egg and spring roll). It was all yummy although we had no idea what to do with all the extra - the sauces and things that came on the side- we needed a tutorial! We will be back!!

I have been here twice so far and I absolutely love it! The food is amazing and they have great service. They are very clean and friendly. I really haven't found many good Vietnamese places in Arizona, so I was really happy that somebody brought me here. If you go here, definitely get the #3 with beef--it is the best.

Food was great, staff was helpful, tiny shop was packed.  I had the Tea Light Special and spring rolls, bother were great.  Counter service, clean and well run.  If you have never tried Pho start here.

Delicious pho take out!! Great for a quick dinner on a Friday night! The chicken pho has only white breast meat which is nice and there are plenty of condiments, the cilantro is even already cleaned up nicely.

I Love Vietnamese food, and I used to come to the place a lot and the food was always great, but the place has really gone down hill. This last time the food was inedible and made me throw up after words. Before this experience I have never gaged after tasting food, but this place made me do that. The fresh spring rolls were anything but fresh and tasted so old that the inherited a soapy taste. Really hope the owners of this place step it up and bring it back to its former level. VERY DISAPPOINTED. If you want truly delicious Vietnamese try Saigon Bowl
Pho is phantastic! 1 & 3 dishes are very flavorful and light.  Highly recommend a visit.
Good food, great services, good people! Definitely give it a try! Pho, bun, rice! They got matcha tea, boba drinks, Thai tea, Vietnamese iced coffee. This is the real deal PHOSURE!
Best chicken pho in Scottsdale in my opinion. Worth the wait during lunch or dinner. Good food all around. Give them a try you'll love them.

This place has the best pho and egg rolls! I am super picky about my food so I am glad I finally found a place that I love and can give good reviews to. I wish I live close to here so I can eat it everyday.

Great little place to grab lunch or Pho to go! My boyfriend and I come here often since it's not too far from our home. Definitely a place we go to weekly. We usually get the same thing every time we go and have not been disappointed. I'm hoping they add a few things to their menu...

I over hyped myself for this place. For me to think think that I would have a decent boba tea within 2 miles of my new home...?   I got the frozen mango boba tea.  The flavor was decent but the texture was something else. There were ice chucks, big bobas, small bobas, hard bobas, and squishy bobas.   I know plenty of places that has good food but not so good boba, so I'll have to give their pho a try!

As far as a variety of Vietnamese restaurants to choose from in North Scottsdale, there is none.  Just the fact that this place exists where it does warrants at least 1-star!  I've been here a few times and it is always good.  The menu is not very big...but everything I've had is always good.  It always bothers me though that they don't call their pho by its real name, or their sandwiches as banh mi.  But oh well, this is NoSco...have to cater to culturally inept folks.  I've had their beef pho, and it was decent.  Nothing to rave about from what I remember, but it definitely works.  I'll need to try it again to give a full report.  Recently I just tried their #7 "Marinated Beef Sandwich" (Banh Mi)...and it was delicious.  Thinly sliced, marinated pieces of beef (grilled), with lettuce, cilantro, shredded carrots, cucumbers, and a yummy mayo sauce.  I'm not as well versed with Banh Mi as I am with pho (im a "pho-natic" lol), but as far as my taste buds could tell....the sandwich was darn yummy.   The owners are always there and as others have said, are super nice.  Although I don't find it to be the most authentic Vietnamese place, definitely stop by this place if you enjoy Vietnamese food and need your quick fix.

I really like pho, but not just any pho. Tea Lite has a limited menu and only had 2 versions of pho, a beef or chicken version. I had the beef version and I even though they are a trek for me, I will be back. The broth was complex, had wonderful depth and the beef and meatballs were very good. It is delish. I also ordered the Grilled Pork Chops and the Marinated Grilled Beef to go. Even though I reheated for dinner, they were both very tasty. I'm sure even more so if I sat and ate at the restaurant.
Pho only and no other items on the menu that pop out.  Overpriced and nothing to make you go wow. I guess I should have noticed the place was empty at lunch time.

This review is only for the Boba Tea. We came with high expectations seeing that it was highly reviewed. We also selected Tea Light because it was the only shop that served bubble tea in the area of Scottsdale that was convenient to our location. I never fault a shop for having a small selection of bubble tea because I imagine that they are trying to serve up their signature flavors (coconut, Thai tea,  honeydew melon, taro and watermelon). I was really looking forward to my dessert libation after a great meal.  However, these hopes were dashed when I tasted my taro Boba tea. The drink was slushie and thin tasting. The most offending point was the bubbles were semi frozen and hard to consume. My friend also had the same experience. It was a deflating experience.  While I sipped, I watched them grill pork and beef. They were creating a lovely char and the smells wafting were enticing. So maybe, when I do come back, I will skip the tea and try a meal.    Tip: Tea Light Cafe is tucked in a corner in the middle of the Harkins Theater shopping complex. Note that their unit number is 1084. It is on the same side as the theater, but you have to look and see if the numbers are increasing or decreasing.

Matcha green tea costs $6 a glass.  What?!  Rip off.  For lunch I ordered the number #3 Bun w/ beef.  Literally was a few pieces of beef and the rest was all noodles.  I probably will be back to try their Pho soup.  But that's it.
Best Pho in town! This cafe is my go to for excellent pho. Location is quaint, clean and the customer service is always impeccable. The beef pho is killer, I can't get enough!!!

Loved it!  This is a terrific alternative to the "look alike" restaurants in Scottsdale.  It is not fancy, meaning there are no white table cloths and the like, but the food is so good and light (and very well portioned)!  The service is friendly and good.  I had to grab my own drinks and silverware, but the table was cleared immediately when I finished.  And the price is right on!

Delicious pho and amazing bubble tea served promptly with kindness. Drove out of my way as a business traveler and I am 100% coming back again. This is an excellent option for lighter Vietnamese fare.

Tea Light Cafe is a great restaurant, no doubt about it.  The only reason for not ticking in at five stars is because of the lack of depth to the menu.  Other than that, the food is impeccable, owners are extremely friendly and the decor and seats always accommodate.    I always order the same thing here, the chicken pho.  I grab a table next to the wall and proceed to wait approx three minutes for that cart to come rolling out of the kitchen with various goodies, all for my consumption!  The huge bowl of soup that arrives, steaming all the way to your table, has a fantastic aroma.    I highly recommend hitting this place up after you see a movie in the theater next door.
This is my favorite Pho restaurant in North Scottsdale area. The broth is tasty and the service is very good. Prices are reasonable. It can be quite busy at times but worth the wait.
Delicious food and "special perk "owner blends exotic teas for traditional medicinal purposes.

Absolutely delicious.  Quality materials, phenomenal flavors - everything to love.  It has a nice mom & pop feel despite being in a strip shopping center in Scottsdale.  It's hard to decide between the beef noodle dish with eggrolls and the sandwiches - so I rarely choose - I just get both and take it home.  This is the kind of place where you order extra to have for later!

As would be expected for a Vietnamese restaurant, this one has tasty, inexpensive food and fast service. No need to wait to be seated; upon entering, you order at the counter and then choose a table and seat yourself. It is smaller than most Vietnamese eateries and has a shorter menu, but the service is friendlier and there is a pleasant outdoor seating area.

This is a very nice Vietnamese restaurant where they serve good food. It's conveniently located within walking distance of the movie theatre! I wished it was open on Sundays, though. I ordered the chicken pho and I thought it was delicious. Yes, I would definitely return.

This is a great little place. So glad I discovered it. It is a small restaurant with a relaxed atmosphere. The food is fresh, well cooked, authentic, and delicious. The service is good and the staff friendly. The gentleman who takes the orders is always ready to offer menu suggestions. The relatively small menu makes it easy to try a wide variety of the restaurant's dishes in only a few visits. I have eaten here four times now and have never been disappointed. For those new to the restaurant and unfamiliar with Vietnamese Cuisine I would recommend the Tea Light Special - two egg rolls, Pho soup, a spring roll, sauces and garnishes. The egg rolls are delicious, crispy, light and flavorful. How they manage to put so many delicious flavors into the delicate Pho amazes me. I look forward to visiting again soon. BTW, it always makes me wonder when Yelp reviewers give a restaurant a bad review simply because they're too stupid to find its location. It's a reflection on the reviewer and not the restaurant.

Fast service, clean facility. But...  * Rice noodles in my chicken pho are gummy.  * Bean sprouts are brown / old. Hard to believe a Vietnamese place does not have fresh bean sprouts.  * Chicken in pho IS NOT FRESH. It's processed. Bad form.  * Tiny plate of the traditional side veggies.  Feels skimpy.  I expect more for an eight-dollar bowl of soup.

Had the best chicken sandwich in the valley, really popular item.  But mysteriously they've now stopped making sandwiches.  Pho and grill are great, but I'm traumatized by this puzzling loss.  Maybe they just want to be a pho bar now?

Having grown up in LA, I'm used to seeking out local Vietnamese places for a pho fix. My bf and I found this place on Yelp and tried it out for the first time a few weeks ago. We both ordered the Tea Lite Special which included one pho entree, a spring roll, and two egg rolls. The beef was good and the broth itself really made the pho delicious. I also enjoyed the egg rolls, but I will probably skip the spring roll next time.  The place was busy, but we had no problem ordering and our food arrived in 15 minutes. The egg rolls and spring roll came out even sooner. Plenty of seating with indoor and outdoor tables.  Good customer service, fair prices, and delicious iced tea! What more can you ask for in a quick and easy lunch spot.

WOW what a place!!! We came during the holidays (that weird timeframe between Christmas and New Years) and it was still packed!   Service is fantastic, incredible kind friendly and professional especially Anthony. The actual physical space is very small and intimate, they have about 6-8 tables to sit outside when the weather isn't hot.   The food was amazing. Roughly $10 per dish and simple menu of about 6 options. I tried my aunts and my dads and loved theirs including mine! I will definitely be back!

I used pass this place every time I went to the movies or to get my nails done next door.  My husband loves vietnamese food, so he had been there a couple of times.  Finally I agreed to go with him before a movie.  I am hooked on the shredded chicken sandwich.  A great combination of veggies (carrots, cucumber, sprouts) and very well seasoned chicken on a crunchy baguette.  My husband had the pho.  I am not big on soups, so I tasted his, I could actually eat that next time, although I have been to this place and I feel like a broken record, I always have the chicken sandwich.
Let me preface this by saying I am Vietnamese and I have been to VN. This place is quick service Viet, catered to the taste of PHX / Scottsdale residents.

The pho is just average. I have had much, much better. I also am not really sure of the quality of their meats. Kind of sketchy. The service is not great either for what you pay. There are much better places in town to get good pho so do not waste your time here, honestly. Sorry, 1 star, not impressed.

We love the Tea Light Cafe! We are here at least one a week. Their pho is amazing and an incredible way to boost the immune system! Their bun is a favorite along with the iced coffee.  Chris, his family and team are wonderful and we appreciate their gracious hospitality.
My daughter and I love this place. The food is always fresh the portions are extraordinarily large and the price is amazing. The staff there is always sweet and kind.
AWESOME chicken soup!  We order it all of the time.  Try this restaurant. The food is excellent.  Great place for lunch and when weather is nice they have a nice outside dining area.
Love new owners of scottsdale AND sedona location! If you want great authentic Vietnamese than this is the place!

Had take out pho (beef) last night, and my friend had the chicken bun.  Just excellent again, and now I'm left wondering why I'm not eating here more frequently than once a month.  The pho broth is consistently excellent, and the beef was served very well, including a well packaged piece of rare beef, as pho should be served.  The ingredients' freshness was superb.  If I didn't mention it before, the packaging, other than being environmentally bad, is very convenient.  My friend reports his chicken bun was pretty excellent.     Anyway--five stars for excellent vietnamese take out.  You should be eating here.

My new favorite place.  This place is sooooooooooo (is that enough "o's" for you?) good!  I come here every chance that I get.  There isn't anything that I've ordered here that I wouldn't order time and time again.  Whenever we have friends come out to visit- this place is a must :)

I can't say enough good things about this place. It's sooo good. It's so good you'll have a battle between your stomach (which will get full and want you to stop eating) and your mouth that will cherish every bite and want you to keep going. I really love the food here

Not ideal for a vegetarian and average at best.  After reading the reviews on yelp I thought I'd give it a try. We arrived and it was super busy so I felt reassured that this was going to be good.. Yeah not so much.  As we waited for our meals we noticed that other diners were picking pieces of meat and sitting it to the side.   As our meals arrived we realized why. As for the vegetarian soup it consisted of broth and noodles.  To end on a positive note, the green tea and coffee were amazing

I am so in love with their chicken pho! Its the best I've had so far! I get takeout sometimes because it is right near work. FYI-Picking up to go is really hard on weekends because of the lack of parking due to the movie theater and other businesses.
Just stop reading reviews and GO THERE NOW! Absolutely delicious food and great customer service. You'll be raving about this place to all your peers and definitely be back again!
Heard this was one of the best pho places in the valley? Mystery meat soup. What the hell did I just eat? I love pho but this place is a hard no.

Thanks, Yelp for helping me find this delicious restaurant in Scottsdale.   They offer good pho! You can get 2 spring rolls, 2 egg rolls, and a pho for under $10 for lunch. The ingredients were fresh and tasty.  It can get very crowded due to the small space inside. However, on a nice day, you can enjoy your meal on the patio. This place is popular and busy...order first, find a seat next. The atmosphere is great!  They don't give out order numbers, but instead someone passes your table with a cart of food and asks you what you ordered. Remember what you ordered! Once you tell the guy, he'll hand you your meal.  Try this place the next time you are in the mood for pho and are in the area!

This is a solid choice for a reasonably priced lunch and I love eating pho outside on a patio; there is just something about the contrast of warm pho and a cool breeze.   The pho itself is okay, but I've had better. As a result of most of the clientele that eat here, Tea Light plays it safe and does not serve traditional phos with tripe, rare beef and such. Over my years of eating pho, I've really become fond of the amount of flavor those pieces bring to the soup, and I can definitely taste a difference. Do not get me wrong though, Tea Light embraces their style and provides pho that is light and very refreshing. Their Tea Light special comes with with a smaller bowl of pho (chicken or beef), egg rolls and a spring roll - more than enough food to fill you up, but not enough to bring you down. When going there, I'd have to recommend that (if you're hungry), the Banh Mi selecion or the bún with egg rolls.   The staff at Tea Light is always fantastic (so fantastic that they earn an extra star for it) and they will remember your face if you're a regular. Also their teas are pretty good as well, and I'm talking about the packaged kind that they sell for brewing. Be sure to check this place out if you're in the area and need a healthy bite to eat, especially as the weather gets cooler!

Great Pho. Always pleasant staff and consistent quality. Prices are a little steep considering the cuisine, but the location is obviously the reason why. Small dining room, that can be hard to get a group of more than 2 into at peak times. Highly recommended, but if your on a budget split a bowl. Trust me, theres plenty.

I like this place for a quick fix. Love the bbq with noodles/rice, eggrolls are ok but I do love the spring rolls. The only issue I have are the boba drinks, they are not very good at all. I wish they would figure it out because if their boba drinks were better, I'd buy a drink daily, seriously! But I do like the place a lot and I think the new owners are really nice.
Veggie  Pho has no veggies just sayin.. Taste bland really average at best.. I really can't say much other than average all the way around....

Tea lite cafe is a hidden gem! We've lived  across the street for a couple of years and we have finally tried it! Atmosphere is small, simple, and vibrant. Even though the place was super packed, service was quick. If you're pushed on time I recommend pick up. The chicken pho was tasty and had great flavor. It has jalepenos so it is a  little spicy. The marinated beef on rice noodles was so good! The meat was tender and had a sweeter/BBQ marinade. The only thing I would say is the meat to soup/noodles ratio is low. Next time I would pay the extra for more meat! I will be going back to try the sandwiches!

I had heard good things about this place from friends and now I am really questioning their palettes! The Pho was very sub par. Not a large portion at all for a $7.95 price tag. They served it with wilted old cilantro and about 12 bean sprouts...no basil. The manager said they were all out of basil in the state of Arizona. The shrimp and pork fried eggrolls for $5.95? Horrible. 3 pieces cut into half served with two small pieces of lettuce and old cilantro and 1 sprig of mint. It's like they don't keep their veggies in a cooler. There is much better Vietnamese food in the city, try Pho Tanh and Maxim, both in central Phoenix.

Try the marinated pork chops. I am hungry as I am writing about them. The combination of rice, side salad and pork chops is a good one. And surprisingly they are generous with the portion. Me like it!

I totally dig this place because it has some tasty broth for the Pho. I was super confused on how to order and the menu and all that but in the end I just ended up with a bowl of Pho, which was fine with me!  The broth was so good I really didn't have to add anything to it.   I went in at about 12:45PM. This seems like a place that a lot of people that work in the area go to. The staff was very friendly to everyone and I think that everyone else in there was a local.   Pretty good and is going on my list!   Oh and to find a Pho place that has a soda fountain machine is rare! Other places usually just give you a can of soda. Not this place. Fountain all the way!  I'd go back, for sure.

This place is so so yummy! I always crave it when I want a delicious meal that is also helps me get over a weekend of too much drinking and eating. Their veggie ginger broth Pho is the best because it doesn't have the added sugar. Just add chicken or rare beef to it and you are all set.

My go to place rain or shine ! All their pho is awesome and the broth smells/taste fresh. Cleanest pho  place I been to in the valley. Their soups come with a side plate of water sprouts, basil leaves, and fresh lemon juice. You get a Big Bang of flavor for 9bucks , also be sure to try their peanut sauce!
This is a great place for Pho.   Go now, try the chicken or beef Pho, and get a side of spring rolls.   The. Best. Ever!

Super friendly staff great food! The Pho is great for first timers and the Pho lunch special is hard to beat. Also love their #3, noodles, egg roll and beef. And cant say enough about their porkchops.  It can get busy at lunch but the outdoor seating is great when the weather isn't scorching.

Absolutely unimpressed with my latest visit today. I made an over the phone order for some spring rolls, and I was told a five minute wait. I got there and the food was indeed ready, but when I went to the counter to pay, the 10 year old boy (I know this is a family owned establishment but come on..) charged me $10 and change for a menu item that is advertised at $6.99. I asked the boy if this was correct and he said yes. So I paid for my three dramatically overpriced spring rolls and left. Once I got in the car and looked at the order they were completely wrong... Expecting the spring rolls to be the traditional vietnamese spring rolls with shrimp and pork, they were some sort of dark meat, messily wrapped concoction that is nothing similar to what was expected or what they have served there in the past. Buyer beware..

2.5 to 3.0 stars but i'm feeling generous so i'm going to rate up.  I've been here 4x-5x to satisfy a pho or banh mi craving and each time I leave feeling a little unsatisfied even though I know not to expect much.    Pros - 1 of 3 Vietnamese restaurants in the N. Phoenix/N. Scottsdale area - Small, locally-owned business - Safe intro to vietnamese cuisine   Cons - Lack of choices/competition in the vicinity keeps the food standards     set to mediocre - Atypical pho menu:  beef version omits tendon, tripe, and different     slices of beef - Where's the meat? Skimpy with the meat in pho  - 3 ham banh mi (sub) should have 3 types of pork not 2.  Otherwise call it a 2-meat sub.   - Subs don't have the standard offerings like daikon radish or peppers  - Pricey. $7.25 for pho and $5 for banh mi.  Yes, for those that aren't    familiar $5 is high as it is double what other places charge.  this is what a vietnamese sub should look like: http://www.chow.com/assets/2009/07/pork_pate_banh_mi_sandwich_600.jpg

Worth everything you pay here.  I used to drive about 7 miles for Pho, but now I come here, less than a mile away for my fix.  I love to order the beef special with rare beef, brisket, and beef balls to go.  Their broth is really clear.  Their egg rolls are really good as well.  Worth the try if you live in the area!

With all the great reviews, maybe my expectations were too high, but the food was mediocre at best. The menu is limited, and it doesn't feel like I'm eating out there. I like the experience of eating out, and there wasn't much here. It was just odd to me.
Delicious. We had beef bun, spring rolls and beef phô. Nice little place to stop for quick dinner before the movies - conveniently next door.

Came here during lunch to get my Pho fix. This place has good, friendly service and a nice outdoor seating area with umbrella shades. I ordered the fresh spring rolls and beef pho. Both were good but not the best I've ever had. The spring rolls must have been prepared much earlier in the day, the rice wrapping was very dry and leathery. The beef pho had a nice broth, plenty of meat and noodles. I wish it had come with more herbs in the side. Overall, this is a good Vietnamese restaurant.
Love the Pho, but they could use a little better quality chicken.  Still delicious!
I eat here probably 2-3 times a week (yes, I know I have a problem).  Food is affordable and delicious.  Love it

Got a dinner to go at the Tea Light Cafe last night and was really impressed.  The chicken pho is delicious and comes with the toppings (noodles, chicken, cilantro, etc) on the side.    We tried the chicken and the beef bahn-mi which weren't completely authentic but really good sandwiches regardless.  Overall, really liked the food.  Only mistake was to try and pick it up on a Friday night around 7pm.  The parking lot was filled with movie-madness.

It's date night and you're headed to the movies. Now the dilemma. Eat a small mountain of hot, faux-buttered popcorn at the movies, or a little popcorn and a  decent meal afterward. I go with both. Only I'm usually too full to eat anything of decent substance after all that popcorn so I typically come here. Tea Lite Cafe.  It's cheap and filling and, its under ten bucks. I've tried both the chicken based pho and the beef, go with the beef...it has a ton more flavor. Another bonus is how the meat in the soup is all very recognizable, putting that whole dog and cat meat thing to rest.  A large bowl will feed two. I weasel most of the meat out of it when my date goes to the bathroom.  And she wonders why I fart so much.
