Fast service great food.. The broth in the pho is as good as it gets.. It's tucked away by the movie theater but it's a gem.. Very fresh very good.. Try the mango boba..

Tea Light Cafe has been one of our few go-to eateries that has been consistent and dependable in providing us with meals that are delicious and satisfying.  We've tried just about everything and love each and every dish. Whenever I have the sniffles, I want their Pho that comes with the freshest condiments. Their broth is so flavorful all on its own but blends beautifully to all the condiments.  My personal favorite is the grilled marinated pork/pork chops. Whether it's served with rice or on vermicelli, it's a win! The finished product after grilling is just amazing with its sweet & savory marinade caramelized to perfection. This will have you craving for more again and again.
A tip of the hat, make that a Non La, to these folks and to Vietnamese food in general.  The perfect place for a quick and filling lunch that's easy on the old wallet and gentle on my diet.
I love pho and this is one of only a few places that make it right every single time. My coworkers and I love this spot. Everything on their menu is delicious including their spring rolls!

I've been coming to Tea Lite Cafe for their Beef Pho for the past several years ...   I believe that they may be one of the only Pho spots in N Scottsdale...?  So, they definitely fill the void in the market place.  It is located in the plaza across from Whole Foods in the faaaar northeast corner of the plaza ... East of the movie theatre.    The owners/management here are kind pleasant individuals.  In the several years that I have come here they have only goofed up my order a few times, so their service is fairly consistent for the most part.  There Pho is not the best that I have ever had, but it's very good for N Scottsdale standards. They use fresh ingredients; on a few occasions I have gotten some mint leaves that were starting to go bad, and some of the meat was very fatty, but I am a reasonable person, and I understand that these things happen from time to time.  The facility itself is very clean, modern looking, and it's a relaxed atmosphere.  They do have pretty expansive hours of operation, which is very convenient if you work later into the evening - it's very nice to be able to call in and order on my way home.    Overall, I've never had a bad experience here, and their Pho is pretty good and their price points are reasonable for this area of N Scottsdale, so they deserve a solid 4 star rating. I have recommend my patients, family, and friends to come here and try it out for themselves!

Excellent little place in North Scottsdale to get Pho! Try the tea light special. So much food for like 8 bucks. You get to try two of the rolls and pho. The best part of this lovely little place is that there are vegan versions of everything. We also got the matcha, good but not really worth the $6 price tag. I know quality matcha is expensive but for the amount of matcha we received I'd simply rather buy my own. Besides that, everything else was perfect! The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere clean. Would highly recommend!

Awesome food every time.  I've tried several places for pho around Phoenix, Scottsdale and Paradise Valley and this is by far my favorite.  You can taste the difference in the quality of ingredients.  Yum.

Torn whether or not to make this review or keep this more secret. This is one of the best deals in Scottsdale, perhaps all of the greater Phoenix area. In my opinion Costco hotdog and drink good!   The Tea Lite Special (dine-in only) is a small pho, one summer roll and two spring rolls along with all the dressings for $9.99! I'm totally floored at how much food for the money you get here. Plus the choice of beef, chicken or shrimp pho, wow.  I'll be back for sure, maybe tomorrow...  Summer roll shell is soft and had a half shrimp. Their peanut sauce could be peanuttier...is that a word?  Spring roll are nice and crispy with standard pork and vegetable filling. Comes with a lettuce leaf and cilantro if you like to wrap them.  The sauce is a standard fish sauce with sugar. Not super sweet so a plus. The cucumber and lightly pickled carrots are a good touch.   Pho comes with a good size piece of basil, bean sprouts, a couple slices of jalapeños and a wedge of lime. I chose the beef version and it came with rate beef as well as meatballs.  Broth was not overly oily or salty.   Maybe, shrimp pho tomorrow...they have boba too...
One of my favorite pho house. Its very ordinary pho and other dishes. Only one thing i dislike is they using no filter water.
in from out of town but every time we are in phoenix (every 3 months) we come at least twice in less than a week great food it's a must if you are in the area and I'll bet you'll be back

Tea Lite Cafe's offers a quick and delicious meal. Located in the same complex as the Harkins 101 Theater, Babies-R-Us and several other large shops. Tea Lite offers a nice meal option for shoppers and business people alike. I recently visited with Gabi M, who is an expert (in my eyes at least) when it comes to Vietnamese cuisine and luckily I was with her to guide me through the menu. I wanted to get a full taste of Tea Lite Cafe, so we ended up ordering the Tea Lite Special which comes with spring rolls, egg rolls and Pho (choice of chicken or beef). This is absolutely the way to go, especially if you're a first timer! It provided a nice variety and was large enough to share. It's also very inexpensive and less than $9 for the entire dish! I thoroughly enjoyed the Pho and added hot sauce and the various spices.    There's not much to say about the atmosphere because there isn't much to the cafe. It feels like a cafe that you'd find in the busy streets of a big city. It's casual, clean and they featured pictures of the menu items on the wall. The service is incredibly fast too! We barely got our drinks and sat down and our food was already being served! It's perfect for a busy lunch hour.   The owner was very friendly and helpful during our ordering process. We ordered a decent amount of food and after our meal, I decided that I wanted to try a BOBA because I had never had one before. However, I only had a credit card and they have a $5 limit. The owner was so nice that he ended up just giving me the BOBA because I had already ordered so much. It showed their level of customer service and his gesture went a long way. Meow, what are you waiting for? It's time for you to visit for lunch!
Decided to stop in for lunch one day after getting a massage and I had the Chicken Pho and tea and it was AWESOME! Now I know why the place was packed!!! I will for sure be back soon!

Ordered take out on a trip to scottsdale for a conference. I didn't have the pho but had the Bun thit nuong cha gio...which was pretty good. It is what I expected from the dish. Vermicelli, nicely marinated grilled pork, a plethora of veggies and nicely fried chunky pork eggrolls. It is in the classic vietnamese style..nothing strange about it (I have had this at places that use spring mix, and pineapple slices...weird). I called in, and picked up..it was all very efficient. Portion was large and equally distributed among components.   I'd come back if I were back in town. Not THE best viet place, but a good go to place for lunch or dinner.

I've been eating here for over a year now and the food has always been consistent and fresh. The broth of the pho has always been one of my favorites and the marinated beef Bahn mi (vietnamese sandwich) is out of this world. It's very easy to feed 2 people, a filling meal and healthy meal for less that $20.  I've noticed that the place has definitely more customers now so that tells me that the cafe is doing something right. The service is always quick, kind and mindful.  I will always be a customer as long as they are in business..

Love Tea Lite but will now frequent much less.  Why, because they stopped making one of the best sandwiches on the planet.  As of about a week ago, we were told by the person running the counter that they have stopped making their version of the Banh Mi, which is a great chicken sandwich.  Was told it was too difficult to make.  Why you would take the item off of the menu that Phoenix Magazine listed as one of the 20 best sandwiches in the city doesn't make sense.  Bring it back!
Great pho, great service, everyone is always smiling!! I make a trip at least once a week-even when it's hot-to satisfy my pho cravings. And the egg rolls are to die for!
Very good Pho, and very healthy place too. Will definitely be coming back here again.
Shrimp spring rolls had too much rice paper making it a bit gooey and stiff. Sauce was too watery.  Overall,  just so so,  compared to my regular places in Chandler. . Will come back to try the pho.

This place is a real gem for foodies.  The ambiance is bistro-like, the food is of highest quality, and the place is always clean unlike many other Vietnamese restaurants.  The prices are very fair for the quality of food you get.  This ranks high on my list of the best places to eat here in the Valley.  Make sure to ask about the teas.  This place has the best tea in the Valley.  The Macha tea is a real healthy kick-starter and tastes so refreshing. Yummie!

I had walked near this place so many times when going to the movie theater, but never thought to try it until my sister did and gave a rave review! Went here for dinner and thought that the food was reasonably priced and tasted good. The restaurant is pretty small, a lot of the tables were taken when we went around 7pm. The restaurant was clean and nice though. The service was very fast, which was great!  I ordered the Tea Light Special, vegetarian style. This was nice way to sample a few different things. It came with pho, two eggrolls, and a spring roll. I had never tried pho before, but I love noodles and soup so I enjoyed it. The spring roll wasn't great, the wrapping was a bit too chewy for my liking. The eggrolls were pretty god, not the best, but they were tasty! My friend got a dish with pork and rice I believe, I don't remember exactly what it was called, he enjoyed it but thought the portions were too small. I wasn't too filled up from my meal either, probably a better place for a lighter lunch versus somewhere to go when you're starving!
Great food with friendly and fast service. They have a few gluten free options and everything is dairy free. I would highly recommend Tea Lite!

(Lyrics - Sebastian (The Little Mermaid) - Kiss the Girl)  Steam Rice Plates! Egg Rolls! Words!  There you see it Sitting there across the desert It doesn't have a lot to serve But there's something about Pho And you don't know why But you're dying to try You wanna taste the Tea Lite Café... (Sebastian from the Little Mermaid - Kiss the Girl)  Tea Lite Café is nestle in the Scottsdale plaza off Scottsdale Road and the 101; west of the Harkin's Theater. This little gem serves up traditional Vietnamese cuisine on the North side of Scottsdale, which was rare back in the early 2000s when I moved to Phoenix. Vietnamese food was hard to find back then, but now it's starting to pop up everywhere since Pho is fast becoming a popular dish.  When I first visited this joint back in the early 2000s, they had their Pho called beef Noodle Soup instead. I gather it was a way to better explain to the public what Pho really was. Now it's back to Pho and it taste much better too! Yah! Aside from Pho, Tea Lite Café serves up some of my classic favorites Bun Mi sandiwhced, vermicelli bowls, and steam rice plates. Voted best sandwich by Phoenix Magazine back in 2010, their specialty sandwiches, also know as Bun Mi, will not disappoint.  Moreover, it is not to imply the rest of their dishes will disappoint, cause I definitely recommend their vermicelli bowls with your choice of meats; beef, chicken, or pork. Also known as, Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio, it comes along with egg rolls and served a top of fresh carrots, cucumbers, bean sprouts and cilantros. One thing I love about Vietnamese cuisine is the utilization of fresh vegetables and seasonings like cilantro giving it a distinctive scent. Vietnam is heavily Buddhist thus having a strong vegetarian background and the usage of vegetables along with their cuisine.  I'm not sure who the Chef is, but she seemed very friendly and came out to speak to the patrons. Some of the regulars seem to enjoy her company a lot. The waiter was very stiff and seemed like he was mad all the time - reminded me of my dad haha! (Sorry pops!) The place itself is cute and tiny. It was somewhat cluttered, but I enjoy that closeness to be able to see and speak to other patrons. - Enjoy!
I love the banh mi sandwich ... and of course, boba! Who doesn't love boba tea? My faves are honeydew and watermelon.

They won't sell Tealight Special as take-out.  Why?  "It's smaller portion".   Fine, can I get the soup and order just one spring roll?  "No, I can't sell you just one," he spits at me like I'm total idiot scum.  Wtf, you make them one at a time and would do it if I were dining in. There are literally no other customers so what's the inconvenience.  At least be nice and give a proper explanation, I'm ordering for my sick wife for goodness sake - I'm not a homeless beggar.  F* this place and their disregard for customer service.  The chicken soup is too salty as well.

Doing Keto and really felt like Pho.  Ordered the beef pho with out noodles.  Turned out awesome and surprisingly filling.  Didn't even miss the noodles.    This will be my go to place when I feel like pho without the carbs.

wow.  the reviews for this place are hard to comprehend.  i guess this is a case of phoenix-area residents having no basis for comparison.  the pho here is not good at all.  in fact, this did not even qualify as pho in my mind.    instead, the "beef pho" was really just weak beef broth that tasted like it was made from a mixture of powdered beef broth and hot water (or just a heated up can of beef broth), rice noodles, and a couple pieces of flavorless beef.    it lacks ALL of the distinctive flavors that define pho.  maybe they can't get those ingredients in AZ -- but then why try to open a pho restaurant?!?!?  i have been to numerous pho restaurants in places with large vietnamese communities (i.e. san jose and orange county) and i've had quite a bit of bad pho before.    but this place was by far the worst.  so bad in fact, that i cannot even call it pho.   i won't bother reviewing the spring and egg rolls.  they were awful.   the staff seemed friendly enough, so that earns them the one star, otherwise i would want to give them none (and yelp should allow that option!).    if the staff/owner is reading this, i realize my review is harsh, but i have to be honest.  i appreciate your attempt to bring pho and other vietnamese food to the valley, but this is really just a disgrace.  you are introducing hundreds of people to these kind of food and that is an enormous responsibility.  please do it right.

Mmmmm. The beef pho is soooo tasty as is the beef sandwich. Why they dont have the bacon sandwich [Banh-mi] is beyond me. It's a little more than I'd like to pay for Vietnamese, but it's worth it. I have been twice and everything has been great. The egg rolls were a pleasant surprise as well. Definitely a place I'll be back to. Owner is a not a talker or smiler but does have an awesome metal cart on which he toodles your food out to you. Awe-some!
Fantastic beef noodle bowls. The beef is perfectly charred and delicious. My only complaint is that the staff isn't always super friendly and sometimes the wait is a bit much.

I've been to Tea Lite Cafe a couple of times over the years, with my most recent visit today when I went for lunch with Lindsey F.  TLC may not look like much from the outside, (it sits in a far corner of a strip mall and it's got a tiny little storefront and sign), but it's a fast-casual concept with moderate prices, friendly service, and pretty good Vietnamese food too!  I'm a huge Vietnamese fan, so it's always a difficult decision when it comes to ordering, but TLC's menu is short and sweet.  Highlights include the Spring Rolls and Pho.  If dining in, I recommend going with the Tea Lite Special which allows you to sample one spring roll, two egg rolls and your choice of chicken or beef pho soup for just $8.99.  I love all of the sauces they serve from fish sauce, hoisin, siracha, and more; I enjoy mixing them all together!  TLC also offers boba, which I love but have yet to try it since I'm typically pretty full after demolishing my meal, but I will be back soon next time the boba craving hits!
Great Pho soup. No msg and really fresh ingredients.  We also had the vegetable spring rolls. Excellent flavor we will be regulars.

I only give this place 4 stars because I am not sure who to compare it to. I have not branched out and found other convenient Pho places near me since I moved to the Valley 2 years ago. This place is right near my work, and I can get in and out for lunch in well under an hour. It is a 'mom and pop' place and the owners are always manning the register or serving the food. I like that. I have had both the chicken and the steak Pho, and the steak kind of turned me off. The beef looked very unsavory and didn't taste great, but the chicken is always good and never too dry. All in all, a good place to try.

Yay!!!! I've finally found a decent Vietnamese restaurant in North Scottsdale.  I had the PHO (customized the way I like it) and a sandwich.  Both were really good!  Very reasonably price and the service couldn't be faster.  I just wish they had a bigger menu but they have the basics so I will be back for sure!

Tealight is one of those places  that leaves you longing for "more".   Chicken Pho, was flavorful as usual but a bit on the cold side which left me dismayed as I was truly in need of something warm and flavorful to comfort my soul on this cloudy and winter like day. The heaping amounts of fresh bean sprouts, thai basil, seedless jalapeno slices, and lime wedges were enough to pardon the lack of proper broth temperature. (I'm somewhat forgiving)   Start off your meal off right with an order of the  crispy egg rolls! Wrap them in a lettuce leaf that it's served upon and, nestle that little bundle in the lovely clear like fish sauce and reminisce about_______. (Sigh)     They also have a nice selection of herbal teas that are served table side in charming little cast iron teapots. Reasonably priced and enough to share with a friend/spouse.   The tables are kept clean, and always loaded with hoisin sauce, red chili sauce...and the unequivocal sriracha (pardon my spelling). (Remember, when I said I was forgiving? Yeah, we'll it's reciprocal)   Return to the Tealight Cafe...you must...you shall!!

May not be "authentic" Vietnamese, but that doesn't mean it's not terrific. Went back today and had the Tealight Special - a good size bowl of Chicken Pho, a spring roll (shrimp, noodles and veggies in a rice wrapper) and two small pork & veggie eggrolls. Dipping sauces add just the right balance of sweet, sour and salty. The fresh basil is the perfect addition to the Pho -- love to rip it up and add it all into the bowl. So fragrant. Good, good stuff. A big, tasty change-of-pace lunch for about $9.00. All good.

HIGHLY NOT RECOMMENDED: "They" say there is a first time for everything. And there is also a last time. Today was probably both times for me at the Tea Light Cafe.   After ordering our food, we were presented with the option of eating outside in 100+ Degree temperatures or waiting for someone to clean the only 4 top table open. We elected the latter of the 2 options. After patiently waiting for someone to clean the table I finally cleaned it myself. Ok. Not too bad but not what I expected.   Our food came out lightening fast!  As I took the first bite of my egg roll, I was in heaven!  It was delicious. Next, I took a bite of my beef and it was ice cold. I asked my wife how hers was and she said cold. It dawned on me that while I was putting the dirty dishes left on the table by the previous occupants, I noticed a cart with 2 pre-made lunched that were exactly like ours. Seeing this was my first time to Tea Light Cafe, I thought maybe our meals were supposed to be cold. I asked the guy that dropped them off if that was the case. He said no and that he'd be right over to fix it.   He scooped up our meals and came back a few moments later. Our meat was warm but it was as tough as shoe leather. My wife stated the obvious, they reheated our meals and presented it to us. Too bad, as that is the worst thing a restaurant can do.   I think we caught them on a bad day, as the foot traffic was nonstop.

I am definitely not an expert in Vietnamese food, just to put that out there.  That said, I really enjoy Tea Lite Cafe.  My co-workers and I go here regularly, and it is a staple in the portfolio.    I get the #1 and honestly don't remember its name, only the deliciousness of the rice noodles and beef.  The beef has amazing flavor and I wish there was about twice as much included in the dish (not just because it tastes good, but also because I could use a little bit more protein to get me through the afternoon).  We often get an order of the shrimp spring rolls to help supplement the lunches here.  The service is very fast.  Important tip for weekday lunches:  get there early!  This place fills up quickly and does not have many tables.
We love this little restaurant. Amazing and fresh salads, delicious chicken&  rice vermicelli noodles pho. 5 stars when it comes to excellent customer service also

I am a long time Vietnamese food fan... this place is right across the street from my office, so I hit it up for lunch pretty regularly.   I've had the beef and chicken pho, and the bun (noodle bowl thingy), not tried the sandwich yet, but I will.  The soup broth is great. The noodles are tasty.   The beef soup is my favorite - it contains the yummy viet style meatballs, rare beef, and brisket. Only complaint is that it should come with more herbs, but this is Scottsdale... not Da Vang or Maxim on the Wessyde.   The spring rolls are pretty good. I've had better, but I order them sometimes, anyway. A Viet spring roll is wrapped in rice paper, with noodles, pork, shrimp, and herbs inside. Not deep fried. Yum. Eat with peanut sauce, and some chile sauce or sriracha.  The bun (noodle bowl) is really good, too!  It's clean, the service is fast, and the food is tasty and healthy, unlike most everything else in that shopping center.   To the person who said they never saw a Vietnamese sandwich before... fail. :( It's a wonderful result of the sad history of French colonialism in Vietnam, and these days, typical Viet fare. I love them at Da Vang, and will have to try one at Tea Light some time soon. Expect an update when I do! But... the pho is so good, I don't usually stray from it.   Down side: With a belly full of noodles, I want to take a nap.

The Pho is to die for! My favorite is the Tea Light Special because it's a taste of a couple different appetizers and a soup. Be sure to try the boba drinks, they're delicious and they offer a good selection of flavors. I love how small it is and how it has a family run business feel to it.
Best soup if your sick! Always consistent, and flavorful! And the spring rolls are always fresh!

Let me start off by saying I love pho and Vietnamese food in general. My experience at Tea Lite Cafe was awful. The pho was super salty, and one of my spring rolls had a green beetle inside, which I noticed was crawling around after I had bitten into the roll.  I will say the service was very quick and efficient though.

Very bland spring rolls (would benefit from some fresh herbs rolled in) and extremely salty pho broth. 3 stars because of the quick service (but it was early afternoon and not especially busy). If you want good Vietnamese and don't mind an extra 20 min drive go to Noodles Ranch on Thomas & Scottsdale Rd - far better pho & fresh spring rolls!

Tried this place for dinner tonight.  While it was decent, I didn't love it.  We got 2 entrees and 1 appetizer for the family.  I ordered the chicken bun which came with 2 spring rolls.  The kids split an order of pork spring rolls and the hubby got the BBQ beef and rice dish.  The beef BBQ was excellent as well as the noodles in the bun dish and the veggies.  The veggies were very fresh.  The egg rolls were a bit disappointing - sort of mushy on the inside and while the chicken was tender, it had a very generic soy sauce flavoring and not the usual vietnamese lemon grass type of flavoring that I am used to.  Will try this place again, mostly due to the proximity to our home and also to try the pho.

delicious food everytime! this place gets pretty busy during lunch time so make sure you come early. its a bit small but we usually get take out anyways. the hubby has pretty much tried everything on their menu but he says the pork chop is the best.

Went there for lunch with several girl friends.  Greeted and seated ourselves after ordering.  Minutes later, a rolling tray came out with our very hot food.   We ordered the #1 with pork, #1 with beef, #3 with veggie egg rolls and chicken and a Tea Light Special (Pho, egg roll and spring roll).  All were good.  The egg rolls were fresh, hot and crunchy.  While the chicken was plentiful, it had a different type of texture hard to describe.  I kept thinking it was a pork.  Not sure how it is prepared, it is just different from what I am use to.  Prices are reasonable and parking plentiful in this large mall.  Many other diners filtering in and out.

Where to begin.  The beef sandwhich is just awesome and tasty.  The beef is juicy and the sauce is good.  The bread is crispy on the outside yet soft on the inside, combined with the fresh greens on the sandwhich, it's my favorite thing on the menu.  The chicken pho is right up there with the sandwhich.  The broth is just delicious as is the noodles and chicken.  You also have the choice to spice it up with a side plate of other ingredients that accompanys the dish.  The staff are very friendly and nice.
The best pho in the valley hands down! I come here all the time and am greeted with a smile and they treat me like I am one of the family. The food is fabulous and I've never had a bad bowl of pho!

I ordered the veggie pho and it was delicious! The veggie broth was amazing, not sweet or cinnamon flavored like some. I loved that they had all of the cilantro already picked off the stems too, a nice touch I haven't seen with pho before. Overall the pho was delicious and everything seemed fresh. Will be a repeat customer here for sure.

I live and work nearby and while I use to go 2-3 times a week, it has dropped off to maybe once a month.  I've seen the restaurant go through 3 different ownership and the current guy (English/German maybe?) brought in new staff.  The whole place has loss it's appeal of the Vietnamese Pho restaurant as it seems too Americanized now - less savory broth and overcompensating the decor (think buddha and chinese signs).  I'm going to rate this based on being Vietnamese and having my share of this type of food growing up but it is a decent place to have lunch and dinner.  Not the best you can find in Scottsdale and there are better mom/pop restaurants in Phx. With the new ownership, the prices have gone up a bit. One thing that isn't so great is the Boba -- it's more icy than flavorful and probably won't get it again. However, it's a quick stop for lunch or to go for dinner.

Are you kidding me?  This place was far from any Vietnamese place I have ever tried.  It is unfortunate that most people who gave this a glowing review have either never had authentic Vietnamese food, or have no taste buds.  There was no flavor!  I had to put hot sauce on my food to give it some flavor!  And the kicker is that this place is owned by a white guy.  LOL...you have been warned!
great food, great service, spring rolls are great and the PHO is awesome as well! i have started to go here on a weekly basis

Found this little gem with an entertainment book coupon...it was great! I had the tea light special with beef pho noodles and the flavor was awesome! The egg rolls were excellent too. Crunchy, fresh, and hot just like they should be The pho broth was flavorful and tasted very rich and smooth. My mom had the number 1 with grilled beef and it was amazing too. Tender beef, crunchy cool veggies, and a nice sauce that complimented the dish well. Great location right next to the movie theater so it's convenient for dinner and a movie. We will definitely be back, thank you for a great meal!!

In town for a conference and was looking for some good Vietnamese food. I was quite skeptical, since I am from Orange County (the home of some of the best Vietnamese food). With high yelp ratings I decided to give Tea Lite Cafe a chance.   Must admit when I walked in I hesitated a bit. Why?  A Caucasian gentleman was taking our orders. Not that there is anything wrong with this, but for a minute I questioned the authenticity of the food.  I'm used to a Mom & Pop shop where I have to use my broken Vietnamese to order.  But, they are SMART; communication is KEY.  They know their customers and cater to them. I was able to place my order w/ ease (no language barriers).    MSG rating: 0.5/5 KID FRIENDLY: yes AMBIANCE: casual  ORDERING PROCESS:  1) Just like Mickey Ds....you pick which # you want.   Easy! 2) Pay at the register 3) Pick your table and food will be brought to you.   *****THE FOOD GIST********* Rest assure - the cook is Asian.  Food was quite authentic and full of flavor.   BEEF PHO (beef noodle soup):  Broth was clear and well seasoned.  Lots of meats.  Not bad...legit!  COM SUONG NUONG (grilled porkchop & rice):  kids LOVED it.  Porkchop was marinated very well and grilled just right. 2 pieces of porkchop, SCORE!  GOI CUON (spring rolls w/ shrimp/pork):  fresh ingredients and a rather decent peanut sauce.    BUN THIT NUONG CHA GIO (vermicelli noodles w/ grilled pork & egg rolls): This truly HIT the SPOT.  Happy with marinate & grill marks on the pork and a nice crunch w/ the egg rolls.  A rather light dish w/ noodles, meats and lot of veggies.    THAI TEA: consistent w/ Thai restaurants.    In the 2.5 days we stayed in AZ.  We went here 2x.  That says a LOT.  Will definitely return if we are ever in town again.  pssssss.....check out the bathroom. Pretty neat-O!

I have been coming to this place since I can remember, my brother brought me here for the first time and the food is really good, but last time me my sister and her boyfriend came had a weird experience, we got there at 8:25 and it was not very busy, we ordered for 3 and to eat in(they close at 9) they brought our food in not a very friendly manner and we started eating. A group of people came in at 8:45 ish and we saw the faces of the staff being mad at them for coming, like they really didn't want any of us business. The manager I guess turned off some lights and put the closing sign(it was 8:45 and they close at 9 so I guess he didn't wanted anyone else to come in) and did it in a really obvious way in our face( we were eating on the patio). I get it, I've worked at food places and it's really hard but we as costumers got there at 8:25 still on time and the food is great and everything but it was very uncomfortable for us to rush to eat our food. The 2 stars are definitely for the food only because they get 5 on food but only 2 on service!
AMAZING pho. We usually split (extra charge) the chicken pho and thats more than enough food for 2 people. One of the best pho's in the valley, give it a shot!
I had shrimp pho for lunch and it was ok. The broth was blend and the waiter didn't even bother to ask how my meal was.

Fresh and delicious and a great go-to nearby. My favorite Vietnamese spot is located in Glendale, and we moved into Cave Creek, so it's often hard to make the drive. We found this place while going to grab Greek food just next to it and decided to give it a shot. We've eaten there 4-6 times and it's always a delight. The Bun (or Vietnamese Vermicelli Bowl) is my favorite and always a go-to. We get it with the egg rolls for added crunch! We love chili paste too, so we always load that into our bowl and our Pho since we usually split the two meals when we go. Great flavors, fresh, not overly oily and quick too! I recommend this place to family when they come into town and what something somewhat healthy and close by. I also get the Pho whenever I'm feeling under the weather, with some added chili to help kick the bug and cure me up!

What happened to your sandwhiches?   Why did you remove them from the menu?  Miss your banh mi's.  It was great to get a bowl of pho and split a sandwhich, best of both worlds.  Now will settle for just pho.

The pho here is very authentic and a great find for Scottsdale! The actual restaurant is quite small but there is outdoor seating available. It is closed on Sunday though so be warned! - Tea Light Special: a great deal considering ordering the egg rolls by themselves would already make up half of the cost of the special. The egg rolls are very delicious by the way. Fun fact: they tend to "hide" some beef underneath the noodles so just keep looking for it, I promise you will find some at the end when you least expect it.  - Marinated Grilled Beef Bun: a favorite - Marinated and Grilled Pork Chops: very flavorful and tasty

Well, it is complicated once you live so close to Mekong plaza...but this place has a good variety of food and the thing that I most liked was actually the tea and the way it was served!! I realized too late they did have boba tea!!  Food was ok, and the service really friendly. Make sure not to confuse it with the nail shop!!

Close to the movie theater. Great little noodle shop. and that's all it is what makes it great is that they focus on serving great noodles nothing else.   I eat here a lot before and after the movie. If it's Sunday or Monday and there's a football game going on then I eat at Blue 32.  Great food. Great price. Authentic taste

This is a great Vietnamese find!  I have been a loyal customer over the years and even though owners have changed the great quality of food has stayed the same. Everything is so fresh and service is exceptional. It's a nice casual feel and a perfect place to go before catching a movie next door. Prices are reasonable as well!  The pho is in a good size bowl, enough for someone who is very hungry.  My personal favorite is #14, grilled beef and rice. The spring rolls are delicious as well.  This is an all around great restaurant!

One word sums this place up - overrated! It was a Sunday and I tried locating a Thai or Pho establishment and everything nearby was closed except for Tea Lite Cafe.  Located in a large big box shopping center Tea Lite Cafe is small and was fulled to capacity. When I inquired to the Asian if they had a sign in waiting list he replied no so we had to wait and then place our order and then waited to be seated.   When I received my plate of bean spouts, mints, lime and slice jalapenos the portion was the smallest ever for a Pho restaurant. The bowl of pho I received was small with a small amount of meats and was over priced in my opinion. In addition the broth tasted sweet and tasted like sugar was added to the broth!  I don't add any sauces when I eat Pho so this just didn't taste natural at all.  I would not return here again.

Yep, I sure am a fan of this tucked away Vietnamese jewel. Tea Lite is located by a nail place and the Cine Capri in N. Scottsdale area. Has a small patio area to dine al fresco also, if you please.  I order the Beef Pho and it is pretty good! Spring rolls and egg rolls never disappoint me either! They turn out a very nice Vietnamese (iced) coffee too - especially when the warmer weather hits. ;)  This is also the first place that I've seen TV monitor advertising in the bathroom (on the sink hardware). Interesting place!
Amazing food! Best people/owners! Can't go wrong with anything there! The pho is amazing!!
The best Vietnamese restaurant in Scottsdale.  Great Spring Rolls, Bun Ga and Pho Ga.

Healthy food is served here. From the pho soups to all entres, your gut will thank you. I'm so happy to have found this place. We do come here often. Only one dish I do not care for, chicken salad, you get a bowl of lettuce and the chicken not fresh enough for me.
Skimpy on the noodles in the pho bowls. Spring rolls are pretty bad. Ok in a pinch but not a specific lunch destination.  Probably won't come here again.

I love pho and I am def happy that Tea light cafe is super close to my home and work making it super accessible either for lunch or a quick dinner after a long workout.   The pho is pretty good - not the best I have ever had but they do have a solid broth and the up charge for extra meatballs is only $1.00... Which keeps my bowl of delish pho under $10.00, so how can you beat that!   They also offer non pho items like rice and noodle dishes. I have seen a few people enjoying the rice bowls and they don't look bad! I also love that you can order online for pickup.   Quick, friendly, and prices are on point! A def low key pre movie, post movie, or lunch time spot!

Meh. Tea Lights almost hit the spot when we craved Vietnamese and didn't feel like driving across town, but with only 4 items on the menu (no, I'm not joking), I would expect them to at least nail the few offerings they've got. Not so much. The pho is weak, at best. The bun is okay, though I would definitely recommend the grilled beef bun over the somewhat lame chicken version.   No table service, but I'm totally fine with counter service for the right food. The pre-made items I could see in the kitchen were a little off-putting, but we hoped it would come out at least tasting freshly made.  We are leaving with the feeling of a solid "meh". Not horrible. Not fantastic. Maybe somewhere in between. But probably not worth the return trip.

It was a cute place, service decent.  It IS nice that they even have a Vietnamese restaurant in this area.  All this being said, I ordered their pho which was recommended by the cashier.  She says they are known for their pho.  I'm sad to say that I was disappointed.  Their broth wasn't that flavorful.  And the protein portion was very skimpy!  I did like the fact that they had the summer roll and pho combo.  I could live without their summer rolls.  This is Scottsdale, so I am sure they are catering to their taste.  I prefer more authentic tasting.
I definitely love coming here with my family and friends. Quick service and the food is always very good. Love their Thai tea boba too!

I'm probably more a 2.5 star rating here, but it was definitely not a 3 star A-OK visit. First and probably the most frustrating part about our visit was the white guy at the register, he had a serious attitude problem, which I see some other people also experienced. He was short and snippy and gave me one word answers, like help a sister out, I've not been here before. I ordered the #3 beef with no rice noodles just salad. It was supposed to be served with egg rolls, but instead came with spring rolls (which I do not like). We got take out so I didn't realize this until we got home. The salad that came with it was basically all lettuce and a small amount of carrots and 4 tiny cucumber 1/4 slices. The peanut dressing was extremely runny. My husband got beef pho and enjoyed it, wasn't the best he's had but was acceptable. The food came out lightening fast, like less than 5 min which semi scares me. My husband said he would go back and I guess I would if he forced me.

Tea Lite Cafe offers a massive amount of food quick and cheap.   While the food is plentiful, it's still pretty light.  You'll be quite full after eating at Tea Lite, but you won't have that slickly heavy feeling that comes with over indulging in most fast food.  It's a great place to stop in before or after hitting up a movie right next door.  My problem with Tea Lite is the lack of variety in its flavor.  The cilantro in each dish sticks out (not a problem for me but I do know plenty of people that dislike cilantro), but every dish pretty much tastes the same.  The small menu basically offers chicken, beef, or pork as a Pho, Bun or sandwich.  The Pho tasted like the Bun only with brought and a touch of spice from jalapeño.  With the acceptation of the dipping sauce, the Vegetarian Spring Rolls tasted like Bun and Pho, only with the added rubbery texture of the clear rice paper (the tofu tastes just like the chicken).  The hot sauce that's served on the side of the entrees is very good and hot.

Usually love ordering the Tea Light Special for years now but tonight 3/26/16 the broth was no where near the quality. The broth tasted like dirty water and the meat was a little like leather. We did go near closing time so maybe that was the reason. Normally would give 4-5 stars but tonight was a three stars because of average of all the times I have eaten here.  Will try again and update review.

I am a big fan of this place.  It small, cheap, fast and the food is delicious.  I mainly get the chicken soup, the best noodle soup ever.  The service is always good and friendly.  A good place for lunch or to catch a quick and tasty bite before a movie at the Harkins close by.  Try it!

I'm from San Diego so maybe I'm just spoiled with the  best food from around the world located in one city but... Seriously? So my friend and I both order the beef bowl. The food comes out fairly quick so that's one good thing. The rest just downhill from there. The taste of the broth was mediocre, pretty bland. The top was cover entirely with onions and green onions. And the green onions weren't  even chopped well. I had huge pieces of the root in my broth. Now to the soup as a whole. It had maybe 6 pieces of beef, meatballs, and a pinch of noodles. It was the most basic bowl of pho I have ever seen. I am not exaggerating when i say i ate the entire thing with  3 scoops of my chopsticks. For $10 this was the most expensive pho i have ever had and it was also the smallest in portions.   As far as the service, the restaurant is set up where you order in the front and pick a seat. The man in front seemed very bored of his job. For the most part he answered my questions. That is where they recieve their 1 star.  Never will i ever recommend this place to anyone!
Great recondition by a local friend. Quick inexpensive for N Scottsdale area and was super tasty.

This place is incredible! My 5 year old loves the beef pho, everything is always fresh and delicious! Great prices and nice and quite. If you are in the area I would more than recommend this restaurant. The staff are also very helpful and always willing to explain the different dishes. Huge portions as well!

My husband and I both loved this place! The Pho was wonderful and they have some of the best eggrolls I have ever had! The service was friendly and quick.  We will definitely be making Tea Lite a regular.
Many Gluten free options. Food is fresh and healthy  Love the chicken pho and beef or pork bun.  Spring tools are delicious too!

This review is based on the service and the bubble tea only. I got lost trying to find this place and circled around a few times before deciding to just call the restaurant and get directions. I told the person on the phone where I was and if they could tell me where the restaurant was. After a short pause I heard a characteristic phone click as I just got hung up on. Seriously, who hangs up on a lost potential customer that only wants to get to your restaurant to give you business??   Luckily my bubble tea partner in crime Kemlyn B. called to give me directions to Tealight since she had the same problem trying to find the restaurant and had just parked. For your reference it is a few doors down from the movie theater and is neighboring a nail salon.   The bubble tea menu is pretty limited and includes smoothies in honeydew, coconut, strawberry, and taro, as well as various teas and coffees. After hearing a less than enthusiastic response from Kemlyn about the smoothie she had I chose a Thai iced tea with boba. The total ended up being a little over $4.  The Thai iced tea was decent with a light sweetness. The boba was pretty disgusting though. It was very mushy tasting and disintegrated in my mouth as I tried to chew it.  I wouldn't go here again just for bubble tea, and based on the rude service I probably would skip trying it out again for food.

I'm from Washington D.C. where Pho is a way of life.  I started working in Phoenix/Scottsdale about 15 months ago and was always craving a bowl of pho when I started to miss D.C.  Given my love of Yelp! you'd think I'd have just got on here but it just never occurred to me.  I found this place purely by happenstance when  going to lunch with co-workers at Buffalo Wild Wings.  I now go to Tea Light Cafe sometimes twice a week.  I've only been indulging in pho for about five to six years but in that time span I've enjoyed pho in over 50 pho specific or vietnamese restaurants.  Tea Light definitely scores in my top 10.   So specific to the pho.  Tea Light is more of a vietnamese cafe/restaurant that has pho than a "pho spot" where the menu might be 20 variations of pho.  So here go the important parts:  The broth - spiced to perfection. I will admit my palate prefers a saltier pho.   That being said I could show up daily and have them put some broth in a thermos and I could drink it all day.    The noodles - the rice noodles have just the right texture and the right quantity.  Meat - Compared to more pho specific spots Tea Light only offers beef or chicken compared to flank steak and round eye or tripe and brisket.  Though it's limited to beef or chicken I feel the meat is consistently of good quality and portion.  The meat appears butchered properly and I never find myself trying to resolve some giant chunk of fat.  Very lean and very yummy.  Veggies - A little lacking.  Typically you get twice as many bean sprouts, jalapeno peppers and cilantro.  I'm willing to assume though that if I actually asked for more they would give it to me.  I'm sorry to say that given the quality of their pho I never tried anything else on their menu.  I plan on coming back whenever my need for pho becomes unbearable or if I'm just driving by.  This place is great.

I have to say that this was a great restaurant. My partner and I went there for dinner today, and we both enjoyed it immensely. I chose the beef pho, which I had never tried before, and was very impressed. The flavor was very good, and it was filled with lots of great ingredients. My partner ordered the beef and rice bowl, also very delicious. The beef had great flavor combinations, sweet and salty, with a nice kick to it. It came with two egg rolls on top, which were some of the best that I've ever had. For these two entrees and two small drinks, it was just about $19.00, which I think is quite a considerable bargain because of the huge portions that you receive. We will definitely plan on returning to the wonderful establishment, and recommend it to anyone who is willing to try something different!
Finally veered away from my usual sandwich or cold rice noodles and ordered the beef pho....darn it was good!

My favorite here is the chicken pho - the flavors are so clean and vibrant, I find myself just craving it some days.  Friendly atmosphere, quick service, and just near enough to my work to make it a reasonable stop for my lunch break.  :0)  Perfect!
Soooo good! Relatively inexpensive for always fresh and delicious food! Have to come!

I know a lot of people have been digging this place and that's awesome! I love Vietnamese food but... I can't warrant this as true Vietnamese food. As far as the pho, the choices are limited and the meat and broth doesn't have the traditional flavor. On the other hand, there are not many Viet places around n. Scottsdale so if you are looking for a quick fix and your in the neighborhood check tea lite out. Vietnamese food is getting a bit trendy as a healthy meal but don't let this place be the only one you visit. It's a drive but Chandler and Mesa have some real great places for traditional Vietnamese food.
Great little place. Food was delicious and fresh. The service was prompt and attentive. I would come back regularly here if I lived nearby.

My favorite place for Pho! This place is locally owned and has amazing food. I get Pho to go or eat here at least once a week. Service is friendly and food is amazing. It's a must if you love Vietnamese food.

Looove their pho. It's a pretty tiny place, but really clean and everyone is really friendly that works there. It's in a great location too. It's the closest Vietnamese restaurant to me so I go there the most often, in fact I'm going there for dinner tonight!
I love this place! The Thai tea and Matcha tea are delicious. I also love that I can the eat rice noodles as they are gluten free.
This is a nice, clean, friendly restaurant to get an introduction into Vietnamese food.  Nothing too risky but good flavors.  Might just scratch your itch.
Best pho in North Scottsdale! Highly recommend this hidden gem--they have great flavor, great service and plenty of indoor & outdoor seating.  You won't be disappointed!
Best pho I've had. A lot of solid flavors. It is also always busy when I visit, but the service is really quick.

Seems like Yelpers are either hot or cold about this place, and I can understand why.  I ordered the chicken salad and shrimp spring rolls. I couldn't eat the chicken and picked it out of my salad. My first impression of the chicken was, "over cooked". Then came the taste test. Second impression, "tastes like poo". I tried another piece and changed my mind to "tastes like dog food", which is how dog poo starts out. Now, I have never eaten either one, but taste and smell go hand and hand.  After picking out the non-edible chicken, the salad was pretty blah.  The spring rolls tasted like the salad with added mint and shrimps. They were so so.  Don't think I will go back to try anything else.

Scant meat for the price.  I only come here because it's the only choice near my house.  The soup is not bad tasting and hits the spot but could I get a little more protein with those noodles, please?

Good but not great. I got the beef pho and the pork egg rolls. The pho wasn't spectacular. Not bad by any means, but I have had much more flavorful pho in the past. The egg rolls I got because of all the positive chatter about them but even they were only so so. Ill have to give them another try.

Great place to have a bowl of pho for lunch at first glance you might think the pho will be very Americanized but when the first sip of the broth hits your toung you know it was made correct service is very fast so a 30-45 min lunch if you work close by is plenty of time if your ordering a bowl of pho you won't need a apatizer it is a big bowl but if you want to try one the spring rolls are awsome too

Decent Vietnamese food in the middle of north Scottsdale... that's pleasantly surprising! Almost everything is under $10 and portions are pretty generous. I always get their bun varieties and Vietnamese coffee and it's always good.

I decided to come here for dinner after reading numourous good reviews.  I was disappointed.. though the pho broth was very clear, the noodles and meat were not so good.  The noodles were more like rice noodles and the meat was as rough as sandpaper.  The eggrolls were decent, very fresh.  I'm still debating to go back and try the porkchop.   All in all I would rather drive down to Chandler for a good bowl of Pho

This is my everyday go-to lunch spot! I always get the #11 - beef pho. It's a very large bowl and everything is prepared so quickly. The staff is very pleasant and remembers me order, even if I haven't been in for a while. Free wifi too, and some TVs and music. Both indoor and outdoor seating are comfortable and pricing is in line with other places at about $8.

I've been driving by Tea Lite for awhile but never had a desire to try this place but for some reason we decided to try it today.   This is a small little place with a few tables outside with umbrellas and with about 8-9 tables inside. So for a big group is can be a little difficult.   So you order at the counter and then you find your own table. They bring your food to the table. No number given, no name given. They somehow figure out what you ordered. Interesting.   I ordered the Spring rolls to start it off. They looked really good. The rolls were pretty good. There was a lot of vegetables and shrimp. When you put the roll in that peanut dipping sauce, oh my goodness. Really enjoyed it soaking it in that dipping sauce.   I ordered the Beef and Egg Roll. What a meal. Grilled beef, noodles, salad, and egg roll. Loved it all. They give you this sauce to dump all over it and it really brought out the taste. Nice tender beef. Nice salad. Really enjoyed the egg roll. Surprisingly, I enjoyed the egg roll more than the spring rolls. This was a really filling lunch and really good.   My wife ordered the Chicken Pho. She really liked it. Got to try the chicken. Thinly cut chicken and it was pretty good. My wife was able to finish up her Pho. Only issue was it had a little to much MSG. Little thirsty afterwards.   So the service was amazingly pretty fast. Our spring rolls came out really fast. This older Asian man rolled out the rolls on a carts and knew which tables ordered spring rolls. Impressive. All the food came out fast on this cart and the tables were cleaned up pretty fast. Tables were turning over pretty fast.   So I couldn't ask for anything more. Good food, fast service, and big portions. We really enjoyed it and will be coming back again. Enjoy.

I enjoy eating at Tea Lite Cafe several times for lunch during the week.  When I am in the area I usually stop and order the Chicken Salad which has romaine lettuce, carrots, cilantro, cucumbers, and bean sprouts and a lite vinegar dressing served on the side. It is a gluten free salad that I have had many times. It looks good and is served promptly with slices of warm hot off the grill marinated chicken pieces.  My favorite drink is the iced Matcha Green Tea which is so refreshing with orange and pineapple juice blended into the drink. The service is prompt and the staff are friendly.

Lackluster food and over priced. They didn't deliver on the flavorful food expected at those types of restaurants. Feels Americanized. There are many better options in the area.   Only plus, the restaurant itself is clean.

I go to Tea Lite Cafe for lunch and I have always enjoyed it. It is priced right and they get you your food quickly. If you are looking for some Pho I would recommend this place to anyone. The flavor is good. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because it did not blow me away.

We love this place! Never been to Vietnam, but this seems to be the real deal! Try the chicken soup! I always get extra basil and cilantro! Hubby likes the spring rolls. We really enjoy this place in the winter months.

Our favorite place in the north valley for Vietnamese food! Great pho and bun and good service. The owner is friendly and the food is always fresh full of flavor. If you have not been here, you must go!!! The only thing missing is a beer or wine option....the it would be worth 5 stars!
Love this place! It is my go to place whenever I'm craving pho. Prices are good and the service is great. The owner is super sweet and helpful. The pho tastes great along with their egg rolls.

If the star rating was just for the Beef Pho recenlty, it would be 5 stars!  If it was for their Boba, it would be a 1 - thus the compromise of a 3 star rating. The Boba I had was, well, disgusting.  Admittedly, I make my own at home so have high expectations.  Theirs was so overcooked that it was completely mushy and had a very odd aftertaste.  NOT something I would ever order from them again.  Hopefully they've improved it since I tried it almost 9 months ago...I've refused to try it since.

Very bland. The peanut sauce and the nuac mam that was served with my spring and egg rolls were watery and not flavorful as it should be. They skimp on the the greens that typically goes into a bowl of pho. To top it off, the prices are ridiculous for the quantity and quality you get. If you're looking for an authentic Vietnamese restaurant, this is NOT it.

I've only been to Tea Light Cafe once, and I probably won't go back. I just didn't think it was very good. I had some kind of bland noodle-y soup that just didn't do it for me and a strawberry tea.  The tea itself was good, but the gummy-like balls that I sucked up in my straw kind of gave me the heebie jeebies.  BUT, if you really like Vietnamese food, I bet you'd love this place. Maybe I just don't like it because I'm not too familiar with the food.  My friend loves this place and swears by it, but I just didn't see it when I was there and found it a little too pricey for what you get.

One of my favorite places to grab a quick lunch for around 10 bucks.  Their #3 with cooked noodles, vegetables, pork and egg roll is very tasty with the additions of some chili and hoisin sauce.  Highly recommended.
Really great pho.  Delicious broth.  It comes with citrus, jalapenos, sprouts, & basil.  A couple yummy sauces.  Great spring rolls too!

Went in tonight to try this place out. The egg rolls were pretty good, just a traditional egg roll with a crispy thin wrapping and a meaty filling. But the pho....so disappointing. Just bland....none of the complex flavors in a good pho broth were there. Yuck. Never going here for a pho fix again that's for sure.

Maybe we came in on an off day, but I was extremely disappointed. Right when we walked in the cashier didn't look up at us for a good minute. When she finally noticed our existence, she was less than delightful and off-putting.   My friend ordered a Vietnamese Iced Coffee. If I had a time machine, I would use it to go back to this moment in time to stop my friend from such a horrible mistake. Don't order the "Vietnamese iced coffee". It's laughable to even call it that.   After tasting the Vietnamese Iced Coffee, I was expecting nothing from the Pho. I would say it was mildly average.   For the love of god, if this is the only VIETNAMESE restaurant you have ever gone to, do yourself a favor and go to one of the ones in Tempe or Chandler (miss Saigon).
Great place, cheap, clean, healthy food served fast and with a smile. Nice place to have in the neighborhood.

I visited Tea Light Cafe for the first time with a friend - we were both craving Vietnamese. This little restaurant did not disappoint. I ordered the pho - it was ready in a flash!  I had to add a lot of hot sauce and lemon to make the flavors pop, but in the end it was delicious .  If you're in the mood for a quick lunch, this is a great little spot. small but cozy interior, friendly staff and inexpensive FAST food.

Great place to get some fast Vietnamese food. The semi-sit down environment is good for eating out on your lunch break. Tables are clean and have a cool zen-like touch with pebbles and stones embedded inside the glass.  But lets talk food folks. The portions are pretty light, but it sure is tasty. BBQ beef is delicious, and they also have a small boba tea and iced coffee offering. Good stuff.
Food was really good and service was friendly and super fast. Mm mm mm. .................................................................mm

I am huge fan of this place!  I have been going there for about 3 years now as they are very close to my office.  I can call in an order, drive over there in 5 minutes and it is ready for me.  It is always the same gentleman helping me as the cashier.  The quality of the food is AWESOME!!  I am pretty snobby about my Asian food :-).  The only thing that I get confused on is do I tip?

This is our weekly destination for Vietnamese. North Scottsdale is limited on the Vietnamese options, but I believe this is the best in terms of good food, atmosphere, and service. Nice to sit on the patio when it's not boiling outside. The Spring Rolls are always fresh, the ice coffee is delicious, and the pho is great as well. The only con in my book is that the menu is small and missing the more adventurous parts of pho.

although i gave 3 stars i would go back.  tea lite is close to me so an easy choice to start my pho adventure.  liked the combo that included pho, egg rolls and a spring roll.  nice variety and just the right portion.  i always get pho with seafood but they don't offer it so i was bummed about that.  ordered the beef and liked the taste plus it wasn't salty like some places i've tried.  the combo was about $7 so very reasonably priced.

I'll start off by letting you know I wouldn't know good Vietnamese food from bad so mine is not the best opinion.  Since they are, as one other reviewer described, an independent establishment in a sea of corporate chains I have to give them four stars.  That said, I've never seen sandwiches at a Vietnamese restaurant. It's like they are trying to accomodate some of the local crowd that most likely wouldn't eat typical Vietnamese fare.  Ultimately I had a good tasting reasonably priced lunch in a flash. Since they're close to my office it's another plus with all the Scottsdale Road construction.

This is our go-to place at least twice a month. My husband loves the pork chops and I love the pho Tea Lite Special. The food is prepared fresh and you never have to wait. Their salads are excellent and their fresh brewed authentic green tea is a welcome change. Highly recommend.
oh boy, I guess if you haven't had much exposure to Vietnamese food then it would be decent.  I'm from San Francisco and this place would go out of business in a heart beat up there.
I was pleasantly surprised to have received a bowl of pho in Scottsdale that wasn't horribly Americanized. Was it as great at Pho 43 in Phx? No, but, the best in Scottsdale so far!!
I'm a regular here and it never disappoints! Great food, good prices and excellent service!

This is Vietnamese food for North Scottsdale white folks who have never had Vietnamese food before.  It's a fast food style place that gives you food with very little flavor and tells you to start adding sriracha and oyster sauce util it starts to taste good.  Really really bad.

Probably thr best Vietnamese food in all of Scottsdale!!:)) amazing pho/ fresh and fragrant:)) the place is always clean and the employees super polite and friendly. I love coming here and getting spring rolls/ veggie egg rolls and salads/ pork chop is great too. Give it a try!!:))

Love this place! I love it so much that I'm very surprised at the tepid reviews. A cozy Vietnamese deli with warm, fast and efficient counter service, this is exactly the kind of eatery I regularly seek out.   I tried the vegetable sandwich and the Vietnamese coffee. The sandwich, served on French bread, was topped with fresh veggies, including shredded carrots, cilantro and mint, and a sweet aioli spread. It was flavorful, fresh and filling. The coffee, mixed with condensed milk, was sweet, but not too sweet -- just the way I like it.  My only complaint: it's a bit on the high side for this type of fare. My meal came to $10; at Lee's, the tab would have been $7 tops. But this a nicer place than Lee's, where the service and atmosphere leave something to be desired.  I will be back. This place is a new favorite.

I can't believe this place has such high ratings!!! You people need to try real Pho. I just left out of there disappointed! It was sooo Americanized, as I expected but hoped I was wrong. The beef in the pho was tough. The boba pearl was under cooked and hard.
My girlfriend and I love this place. The pho is awesome comfort food. It just feels right in the fall. Be sure to use the sauces on the table to heat things up!
Quite good, large selection, fast service. MUST try thier coffee and iced matcha. Why arent you open on sunday!

On a hot day, on a cold day.  Pho is the Vietnamese version of Chicken Soup for the Soul. YES, we live in a climate where 75% of the year is over 90 degrees. But really there are few things as great as the healing properties of a good bowl of Pho.  My fiance and I have been coming here for years - and within the past year - they have really made some improvements.  They've redecorated, and improved their patio furniture (yes, we've actually eaten Pho outside in the middle of summer!)  They've even gotten new plates/bowls.  Just when we thought they couldn't improve they did!  Tea Light Cafe is an amazing little Vietnamese restaurant located on the cusp of North Scottsdale and Phoenix.  Location Location Location:  Conveniently situated next to the Harkins Cine Capri and Buffalo Wild Wings at the Scottsdale 101 plaza - it is a high traffic area.  Perfect to grab a bite before a movie - OR, if you are like my fiance and I, perfect to grab a few beers at BWW and then head to Tea Light Cafe for some REAL food.    For all the positives of the location comes anegative.  The menu is a bit toned down and you're not going to find the ultra authentic foods here (no tripe or tendon!).  North Scottsdale isn't quite ready for that.  What you will find is a small menu with all of the essentials you need.  A fantastic minimalist approach - offer a smaller menu but offer everything on the menu to the level of perfection.  Like clockwork the super friendly owners and employees know our order.  Beef and Beefball Pho Noodle Soup for me, Vietnamese Pork and Vermicelli Noodles for my fiance, and of course an order of super fresh, light, cool spring rolls to start.  Perfect to combat the heat.  Oh - and a cup for ice tea - because they have some of the most amazing ice tea brews.  Soo refreshing and flavorful you don't even need sugar!  if you decide to split the Pho I believe they charge you a split fee.  But because we always order two entrees - they bring out a small bowl so my fiance and I can share (the portions are huge and there's no way I could finish a whole bowl).  A wonderful, fresh, huge meal for about $20.00!  And let me tell you - nothing beats a hangover like a huge bowl of Pho Noodle Soup (doused in Chili Paste and the Rooster of course!).  Although I've never had the Banh I have friends who have ordered it and loved it!  The one other thing I suggest is to eat at the restaurant.  The food needs to be fresh and hot to really enjoy it.  Hot or cold temps - nothing's gonna come between me and my Pho!
Hidden Gem! Excellent Pho & egg rolls. The employees are fantastic as well. I am always recommending this place.

The chicken pho is my go-to when even the possibility of sniffles is on the horizon and I can't pass up their crunchy and savory egg rolls even when I should be on a broth based diet.   Portion size is beyond generous -- typically at least two meals. I primarily order for pick-up and the wait time is always under 15 minutes. Don't judge the restaurant by it's strip mall appearance. Cozy dining in options including outside patio seating.
Excellent, really great place. Really awesome vermicelli bowls. Ignore any reviews that are under five stars.

I always have the chicken pho bowl and add some chili sauce and hoisen to it...I love this place! The soup just hits the spot! Be sure to add in all the extras they give you, lemon, lime, basil, jalapeño, and sprouts, they make it delicious!
SO Yummy! I was craving Pho and this restaurant was close so I decided to try it! Definetly going back when I'm in the area
Pho is not good here.  Broth tasted like dirty towels.  Sandwiches are decent though.

Friendly staff, good food, great prices. Tea Light Cafe is a good place if you're looking for a quick Vietnamese meal. You order at the counter from a small menu (pho, noodle bowls, and rice plates). Prices were all under $10 for substantial portions. I had a combo noodle bowl (#3) with chicken and spring roll. Food was fresh and flavorful. The staff were also very nice and helped us move around tables and chairs to fit our group. The only thing that wasn't great was the boba, which was a little too soft. Vietnamese iced coffee was great otherwise. We will be back!

A visit to this place is how I treat myself!  I love, love, love the pho, sandwiches, bun, and spring rolls.  If you are undecided on what to order, go with the special-- it's a little sampling of everything.    I know this place "Americanized", I've had more authentic Vietnamese before, but it's still quite tasty ;) It's also very consistent-- something I value in my lunch take-out places. Service is quick and very friendly.  I'm very appreciative of the speed-- when dining in the restaurant, we are able to get in and out during lunch in less than an hour.
This place has had consistently good food. Every time I go there I get my food quickly and it's always tasty. This place is also in a great location; its right by the movie theatre.

Went to Tea Light Cafe with my wife today.  Split a bowl of beef pho (pho bo) with her (Vietnamese Beef Noodle Soup).  Also had an order of goi cuon (Vietnamese salad rolls).  The pho was very good.  The goi cuon was perhaps a little chewy.  Otherwise, it is good.

The Nuoc Mam here is horrible. It is missing so many components that make this dressing crucial to most Vietnamese dishes.  It's too bad because the food is decent. But then you're stuck with bad sauce..and it's not just the Nuoc Mam...the peanut sauce is more like peanut water.  Good: Egg rolls #3 Bowl  Bad: Chicken pho (ok tasting but there is some ingredient in it that doesn't taste quite right....can't quite put my finger on) Spring rolls (mostly noodle filler)  Really Bad: The Sauces (as mentioned above) Pickled carrots mostly taste of salt with no sweetness  So if you are not picky about your sauces, I'd say give it a try. Or if you are a complete newbie. Just know there is something better out there.   I dream of San Diego chicken pho and will continue to pursue it here in Phoenix.  P.S. This place is better than Saigon Nites though!

Tea Lite Cafe was great!  I was very excited to learn there was a Vietnamese shop nearby because I missed getting beef pho.   This place definitely delivered on my hopes and desires. The food was delicious and well priced. My friend ordered a meat and rice dish that I can't remember the name of but he devoured it in seconds.  I will definitely be going back there soon.

I like how clean this restaurant is. It's very casual as you place your order at the counter and sit. The food is good but the portion size can be small if you're used to the huge sizes other Vietnamese restaurants offer. Minus one star due to small portions and lack of variety. They don't offer really authentic Vietnamese choices like tripes, tendons, etc. I wish they offer Vietnamese crepes also. However, what they do have, it's really good.
Great little Vietnamese spot has excellent pho as well as the vermicelli noodles, great egg rolls and spring rolls everything is fresh and made to order.

My go to place when I want something delicious and quick. I always get the pho which is just so damn good! Noodles are soft and the broth is da bomb. Perfect remedy for a cold, sore throat, or an empty stomach. The other reason why I love this soup is that it has no stinky pho smell that most pho soups have. Does anyone know what I'm talking about?! Comes in a big bowl that can be shared or have it all to yourself! A little pricey but nothing to cry about. Mmmm...craving one now...I should go before they close in 30 minutes...

This was my first experience with pho! It is absolutely amazing!!!! I would go here at least once a week. It's a great place to go on a nice day and sit outside. The portions are huge for a great price! I highly recommend trying this place!
Love the beef bun, chicken pho and the egg rolls. Really, you can't go wrong here!

Very good. Heard bout this place for yrs & finally went after a movie; simple, lite & healthy. Great spring rolls & reasonable. Joins other great choices such as blue 32, Carlos o'brien's, bourbon jacks & even Denny's!

This is the best noodle soup bowl place I can find in the area.  I drive 30+ minutes just to go eat here. They are super fast serving up the noodle soup bowls.  Today I got one to go and it was ready before I paid for it!  The people are very friendly.  I've also had the spring roll and it was really good too.  Recommend this for a fast, delicious meal.  It always seems to have people eating there. At lunch today it was packed inside and out.

First and foremost, this fast food Vietnam restaurant is way over priced for a bowl of soup. I had Chicken Pho which was pretty good, nothing memorable, but $9 for a bowl of broth with a few pieces of chicken is just too pricey. My companion had #1 Pork Bun which he said was dry and not much flavor. It was also $9. We also had the Spring rolls which were rubbery and we had no idea they were shrimp rolls until the last bite. They were tasteless and filled with lettuce. They were $7. We were hoping for some good food but we were disappointed. After blowing $30 on lunch for two, we won't be back. Sad because we were very hopeful.

Lived in Seattle for 5 years and when I moved back here I was worried about finding good pho. Tea Light Cafe is incredible! I swear they must use organic chicken and you can taste the difference. Get the #12!!!

I eat here about 2 times a week and it is one of my favorite restaurants! Best Vietnamese food around here. Flavor is fantastic!!!! I usually get one of 3 things; chicken pho soup, spring roll appetizer, bun #3. I can't tell you how much I love this restaurant because it's so tasty and you have to try it yourself. The food is fresh and flavor is on point. Service is great and meats are high quality.
